0.title: Women banned from appearing in ads in Iran over ad showing woman biting ice cream
0.article_body: Iran's Ministry of Culture and Islamic Guidance has banned women from appearing in adverts under the country's strict rules. The announcement came after a commercial featuring a woman biting an ice cream. Iranian officials ruled that the advertisement went "against public decency" and was an "insult" to "women's values".

1.title: India grappling with the problem of high inflation: RBI Governor
1.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said that India is grappling with the problem of high inflation. "Indian economy has naturally been impacted by the global economic situation," the Governor said, adding that the globalisation of inflation is coinciding with de-globalisation of trade. "Nevertheless...India is expected to be amongst the fastest growing economies during 2022-23," he said, citing the IMF.

2.title: People are surprised that Masaba & I call each other 2-3 times a day: Neena
2.article_body: Veteran actress Neena Gupta has revealed that she and her daughter designer Masaba don't live together but keep calling each other. "So many people express surprise when they come to know that we call each other up two-three times a day," she added. Neena further said that she gets to know whatever is trending due to her daughter Masaba.

3.title: She was 12-yr-old on 'Andaz...' sets, came with Karisma: Aamir on Kareena
3.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan said that his first impression of actress Kareena Kapoor Khan was a "really cute 12-year-old girl who was sitting on the sets of 'Andaz Apna Apna'". "She used to come with Lolo [Karisma Kapoor]," Aamir added, while answering a question during his time of 'Koffee With Karan 7'.

4.title: Speeding truck hits school bus from behind in UP; over 24 kids hurt
4.article_body: Over 24 children were injured, including five who sustained serious injuries, after a speeding dumper truck rammed into a school bus as it stopped to pick up a student in Uttar Pradesh's Pratapgarh on Thursday. Due to the collision, the school bus also hit a tree on the roadside. The school bus driver was also injured in the incident.

5.title: ISRO's smallest rocket to launch satellite built by 750 school girls on Aug 7
5.article_body: ISRO will be launching its smallest commercial rocket, Small Satellite Launch Vehicle (SSLV), on August 7. The SSLV will carry a satellite, AzaadiSAT, comprising 75 payloads built by 750 girl students from 75 rural government schools across India. The project is part of the Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav celebrations, to mark the 75th Independence Day year celebrations.

6.title: Loss vs Pak in T20 WC 2021 caused Team India a 'lot' of damage: Latif
6.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Rashid Latif said India's defeat against Pakistan by 10 wickets in T20 World Cup 2021 caused the former a "lot of damage", which they are trying to recover from. "They are taking it series by series...Teams are changing with every series," added Latif. Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar earlier said Pakistan will beat India in T20 World Cup 2022.

7.title: Hyd Customs seize cigarettes, protein powder worth ₹1.15 cr; 14 arrested
7.article_body: Hyderabad Customs on Thursday arrested 14 people for trying to smuggle cigarettes and protein powder into the country. The passengers, who arrived from different flights, were found carrying 150 bottles of protein powder, 4,792 e-cigarettes and over two lakh cigarettes, all worth ₹1.15 crore, Hyderabad Customs tweeted. Last month, officials seized cigarettes worth ₹50 lakh at Hyderabad Airport.

8.title: Pune ACB books PCMC surveyor for demanding bribe of ₹3 lakh
8.article_body: The Pune unit of the Maharashtra Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) has booked a surveyor of the Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) for allegedly demanding a bribe of ₹3 lakh from a private company's employee. The accused had reportedly demanded the bribe to give a "development opinion" in favour of the company's development plan. The ACB verified the complaint multiple times.

9.title: New batch of IIM-I's online Exec PG Diploma starts Aug 13: Unext Jigsaw
9.article_body: IIM Indore & UNext Jigsaw announced that the last few seats are remaining for their online PGDP in Management & AI designed for professionals with 3+ years of work experience. Through the 15-month program, learners can gain Executive alumni status, network with MDs & VPs of top corporate firms, and experience week-long campus immersion with other campus benefits, Jigsaw added.

10.title: India witnessing death of democracy, onset of dictatorship: Rahul Gandhi
10.article_body: Rahul Gandhi on Friday said that India is witnessing the "death of democracy" and "onset of dictatorship". "Anybody who stands against this idea is viciously attacked, put in jail, arrested and beaten up," he added. "What India has built brick by brick, starting almost a century ago, is basically being destroyed in front of your eyes," Gandhi further said.

11.title: Gave 1st screen test in 22 yrs as Aamir wasn't confident: Kareena on 'Laal...'
11.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor said she gave her first screen test in 22 years for her role in 'Laal Singh Chaddha' as Aamir Khan wasn't confident. "Aamir was very sure that I had to screen test...It was actually [my husband] Saif Ali Khan who told me...listen...it's really cool because only Aamir...can actually tell someone...that you have to screen test," she added.

12.title: Centre will take all accounts of Congress' wrongdoings: Haryana CM
12.article_body: Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar defended ED's action against the Congress leaders in the National Herald case and claimed that Centre will take all accounts of Congress' wrongdoings. The CM said, "Congress has already looted Haryana. We are going to take all the accounts of this loot from them in Delhi as well as in Haryana."

13.title: Narendra Modi is best PM ever: Kuldeep Bishnoi after joining BJP
13.article_body: After joining the BJP along with his wife and former MLA Renuka Bishnoi on Thursday, former Haryana MLA Kuldeep Bishnoi told reporters that it would not be wrong to describe PM Narendra Modi as "India's best PM". "I and my associates had been part of...[BJP's] campaign in 2014 Lok Sabha polls when Narendra Modi became the PM," he said.

14.title: Amnesty accuses Ukraine of 'putting civilians at risk', Zelenskyy responds
14.article_body: Ukrainian forces are violating the laws of war and endangering civilians by establishing bases in residential areas, including in hospitals, Amnesty International said in a report. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy condemned the report and said Amnesty International had tried to "amnesty the terrorist state and shift the responsibility from the aggressor [Russia] to the victim [Ukraine]".

15.title: BJP is horrified, is it going to declare Shah as Guj CM face: Kejriwal
15.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party chief Arvind Kejriwal said that the Bharatiya Janata Party is "horrified" because "AAP is growing rapidly in Gujarat". "Is it true that the BJP is going to declare Amit Shah ji as the chief ministerial face in the Gujarat Assembly polls? Is the BJP also angry with Bhupendra bhai Patel's work?" he asked.

16.title: 'Horrible raj': Congress MP after ED questions Kharge
16.article_body: Congress MP KC Venugopal criticised the Centre after the Enforcement Directorate (ED) questioned senior party leader Mallikarjun Kharge in connection with the National Herald case. "Horrible raj is going on in the country. There are parliamentary systems. We are law-abiding citizens...Privilege for Members of Parliament exists for the safeguarding of democracy," said Venugopal.

17.title: Pic of long jumper Sreeshankar's foul by 1 cm at CWG goes viral, fans say 'Robbed of gold'
17.article_body: A picture of Indian long jumper Murali Sreeshankar's foul at CWG 2022 has gone viral. In his fourth attempt, Sreeshankar seemingly crossed the 8-metre mark, however, his jump was declared invalid as he was adjudged to have overstepped the take-off board by 1 cm. "Robbed of gold medal," a fan tweeted. "How can that be a foul?" wrote another.

18.title: Why didn't India's Sreeshankar get gold despite having joint-best jump in CWG 2022 final?
18.article_body: India's Murali Sreeshankar won silver medal in the men's long jump event at CWG 2022 despite having the joint-best jump. Sreeshankar had a best jump of 8.08 metres, the same as gold medallist LaQuan Nairn of Bahamas. Nairn bagged the gold medal as on countback, his second-best jump of 7.98 metres was 14 cm better than Sreeshankar's 7.84 metres.

19.title: How does the CWG 2022 medal tally read as India clinch 20 medals?
19.article_body: After the conclusion of Day 7, India's medal tally at CWG 2022 has reached 20. With six gold medals, seven silver medals and seven bronze medals, India are placed seventh on the medal standings. Scotland, who have bagged seven gold medals and a total of 34 medals, are placed fifth. Meanwhile, South Africa are placed sixth on the table.

20.title: India's real GDP growth projection for 2022-23 retained at 7.2%: RBI
20.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das, while announcing the central bank's monetary policy decision, said that India's real GDP growth projection for 2022-23 has been retained at 7.2%. The RBI also retained its retail inflation forecast for the current financial year at 6.7%. Retail inflation has remained above the RBI's upper band of 2%-6% tolerance range for the last six consecutive months.

21.title: Jharkhand High Court bans promotions of state government employees
21.article_body: Jharkhand High Court has put a ban on all promotions of state government employees. HC was hearing a plea regarding the June 23 order of the Director General of Police on granting promotions to Assistant Sub-Inspectors (ASIs) to the post of Sub-Inspectors (SIs). DGP's order stated that reserved category ASIs can seek promotion in the general category, the petitioner claimed.

22.title: Sonam shares pic of her swollen feet, says 'pregnancy is not pretty sometimes'
22.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor shared a picture of her swollen feet on Instagram and wrote, "Pregnancy is not pretty sometimes." The actress is expecting her first child with husband Anand Ahuja. Sonam, who announced her pregnancy in March, had hosted a baby shower in London. Sonam and Anand got married in May 2018.

23.title: Quite surprised, don't know the reason: R Sridhar on Suryakumar opening
23.article_body: Ex-India fielding coach R Sridhar said he was "quite surprised" to see Suryakumar Yadav open during the T20I series against West Indies, adding he really doesn't know the reason behind this decision. "There is something happening...which we're not aware about," he stated. Sridhar said he immediately checked whether Rishabh Pant was playing on seeing Suryakumar open in the first T20I.

24.title: Modi govt keen to cut short Monsoon Session: TMC's Derek O'Brien
24.article_body: TMC leader Derek O'Brien on Thursday said, "Why is Narendra Modi government running away from Parliament?" "The talk on Parliament Street is that the government is keen to cut short the Monsoon Session and end it on August 8, instead of August 12. Bad," O'Brien tweeted. Last year, all three sessions of the Parliament were curtailed due to various reasons.

25.title: Paytm payments down for many users, company says 'Working on the issue'
25.article_body: Several users have been unable to access Paytm payments on Friday as the app is facing an outage. Users reported they were being logged out suddenly and have been unable to log back in. Outage detection website DownDetector also confirmed the issue on the app. Meanwhile, Paytm tweeted, "We are already working on fixing the issue at the earliest."

26.title: Even getting here is huge: Helly on 'Zibah' qualifying for Oscar nomination
26.article_body: Speaking about her film 'Zibah' qualifying for getting nominated for Oscars, actress Helly Shah said that it's big news. "Sirf yaha tak pohchna hi badi baat hai humare liye (Even getting here is a huge deal for us)," she added. Helly had recently announced that 'Zibah' is among the top three Indian films to get a theatrical screening in LA.

27.title: Congress to protest outside Raj Bhavan in Himachal Pradesh
27.article_body: Congress will hold a demonstration outside Raj Bhavan in Himachal Pradesh on Friday as part of its nationwide campaign against rising inflation and unemployment. "The entire country is suffering due to inflation...Congress is on the streets against the anti-people policies of the BJP government. The [Centre] is misusing institutions...to suppress the Opposition," said Congress leader Alka Lamba.

28.title: Protesting villagers don't let SDM leave office for 6 hrs in Punjab
28.article_body: Residents of Lehal Khurd village in Punjab on Thursday gheraoed Lehra Sub-Divisional Magistrate's (SDM) office and didn't let the SDM leave the office for around six hours in a protest. The villagers demanded that two additional teachers' posts should be created in a primary school. The SDM said that a senior official has been informed about the protesters' demand.

29.title: You will be missed: Hrithik condoles demise of Mithilesh Chaturvedi
29.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan took to Twitter to condole the demise of veteran actor Mithilesh Chaturvedi. He wrote, "Thoughts & prayers for Mithilesh Chaturvedi Sir, a veteran actor who I've had the pleasure of working with multiple times. You will be missed. RIP." The two had worked together in 2003 film 'Koi... Mil Gaya' and 2006 film 'Krrish'.

30.title: India reports 20,551 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 1,35,364
30.article_body: India has reported 20,551 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 19,893 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 1,35,364, while the death toll has risen to 5,26,600, according to the latest data.

31.title: Internal communication not material: Zomato on multiple CEOs & 'Eternal' restructuring
31.article_body: Regarding the company moving to a multiple CEO structure and rebranding itself 'Eternal' internally, Zomato told the BSE that it had not shared its CEO Deepinder Goyal's "internal communication" with the media. It said, "The internal communication is not material and does not mandate any disclosure." Their response came after SEBI sought clarification from Zomato regarding this restructuring.

32.title: RBI hikes repo rate by 50 bps to 5.40% in its third hike in 4 months
32.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) Governor Shaktikanta Das has announced that the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) has decided to increase the repo rate by 50 bps to 5.40% with immediate effect. This is the third hike in the repo rate announced by the RBI since May. With the 50 bps hike, the interest rates will rise to pre-pandemic levels.

33.title: Many people have said I would be 'perfect' for SRK's role in Darr: Kartik
33.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan said many people have told him that he would be "perfect" for the role played by SRK in the film 'Darr'. "The last 30 minutes of 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' when the character of Rooh Baba changes and has relatively serious scenes, many people have said that I can play a grey character quite well," added Kartik.

34.title: Over 50 cattle die at cow shelter in UP's Amroha, CM Yogi orders probe
34.article_body: Over 50 cattle died under mysterious circumstances at a cow shelter in Uttar Pradesh's Amroha district on Thursday. According to District Magistrate BK Tripathi, the cows fell ill after eating fodder which was purchased from a man named Tahir. Following the incident, UP CM Yogi Adityanath ordered a probe and directed Animal Husbandry Minister Dharam Pal Singh to reach Amroha.

35.title: Bomb squad checks unclaimed tiffin box in Delhi, nothing suspicious found
35.article_body: An unclaimed tiffin box was found in Delhi's Rohini on Thursday, reports said. Reports added that a bomb squad was sent to the area to check the box. However, nothing suspicious was found. The National Security Guard was also called in. The area was sealed and the neighbouring areas were evacuated.

36.title: Croma announces 'Independence Day Sale 2022', offers special deals
36.article_body: On the occasion of India's 75th Independence Day, Croma has announced its 'Independence Day Sale 2022' from 5th to 16th August. Customers can get a slew of offers, discounts, EMI options, and other benefits on smartphones, TVs, laptops, tablets, washing machines, and other electronics during the sale.

37.title: Truck driver runs over woman, daughter after altercation over rash driving in Odisha
37.article_body: A 47-year-old woman and her daughter were run over by a truck driver in Odisha's Jajpur on Wednesday, shortly after they had an altercation with him over rash driving, police said. "The matter was resolved amicably after locals intervened," police added. The driver later mowed down the two, police stated. "We've arrested him...charged him under IPC Section 302," police added.

38.title: Kevin Spacey to pay $31 mn to 'House of Cards' maker for alleged sexual misconduct
38.article_body: Actor Kevin Spacey has been ordered to pay $31 million to the 'House of Cards' production company by a judge for alleged sexual misconduct. The 63-year-old was fired during the show's sixth season after allegations surfaced that he had sexually assaulted several men. Spacey failed to show that the $31 million award was "utterly irrational", an LA County judge said.

39.title: At least 13 killed, 35 injured in fire at nightclub in Thailand
39.article_body: At least 13 people have been killed and 35 others have been injured after a fire broke out at a nightclub in Thailand's Chonburi province on Friday, police said. The fire, which started at around 1 am, was brought under control after about three hours. So far, all the victims are Thai nationals, Police Colonel Wuttipong Somjai said.

40.title: 5 Chinese ballistic missiles land in Japan's exclusive economic zone
40.article_body: Japanese Defence Minister Nobuo Kishi on Thursday said that five Chinese ballistic missiles landed in Japan's exclusive economic zone. This comes as China launched its largest-ever military exercises around Taiwan after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit. "We have protested strongly through diplomatic channels," Kishi further said.

41.title: Unfair to hundreds who made it: Rahul on calls to boycott 'Laal...', 'Raksha...'
41.article_body: Filmmaker Rahul Dholakia has reacted to the calls to boycott 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and 'Raksha Bandhan'. He wrote on Twitter, "Trolling a film because a cast...[member's] ideology differs from yours is unfair to the other hundreds who...worked hard to make the film. They have also pinned their hopes on the success of the film to help [realise] their dreams."

42.title: I'm nobody to talk about it: Kareena on failure of Ranbir's 'Shamshera'
42.article_body: On being asked about her cousin Ranbir Kapoor's film 'Shamshera' failing at the box office, actress Kareena Kapoor said that she is nobody to talk about it. Kareena said she hasn't seen the film, adding that everybody treats their film very differently. "Every actor operates...from a different area...To comment on that would be very wrong on my part," Kareena added.

43.title: US urges Russia to accept 'serious offer' on freeing basketball player
43.article_body: The US urged Moscow to accept a deal to free basketball player Brittney Griner, who has been sentenced to nine years in a Russian prison over drug smuggling. "It's a serious proposal," White House National Security spokesperson John Kirby said, adding, "They should've accepted it weeks ago when we first made it." US President Joe Biden called Griner's sentence "unacceptable".

44.title: Sensex jumps over 100 points, Nifty above 17,400 in opening trade
44.article_body: Benchmark indices opened in green on Friday with Sensex and Nifty surging 137.02 points and 42.70 points, respectively. The Sensex opened at 58,435.82 points and Nifty at 17,424.70. Tata Steel, Ultratech Cement, L&T, ICICI Bank, M&M, and Bharti Airtel were among the top gainers, while GAIL and ONGC slipped. Nifty Metal and Nifty FMCG also saw a surge.

45.title: Will not allow China to isolate Taiwan: US
45.article_body: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi on Friday said that the US will "not allow China to isolate Taiwan". Responding to accusations that her trip showed that the US supports Taiwan's independence, Pelosi said, "We have said from the start that our representation here is not about changing the status quo here in Asia, changing the status quo in Taiwan."

46.title: Man kidnaps 4-month-old boy while grandparents have meal in Raj hospital
46.article_body: An unknown man kidnapped a four-month-old baby boy from a government hospital while the infant's grandparents were having a meal. The infant's family had brought him to the hospital, following which, he was admitted. The family met the kidnapper at the hospital. He had told them he was also accompanying a patient.

47.title: I had more kids than they made cars: Musk as Tesla rival sells 679 cars in Q2
47.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk took a jibe at the rival electric car maker Lucid after its quarterly earnings report revealed that it delivered 679 cars in the second quarter. "I had more kids in Q2 than they made cars!" the world's richest person wrote on Twitter. Compared to Lucid, Tesla delivered more than 254,000 vehicles in second quarter of 2022.

48.title: Death toll due to spurious liquor consumption in Bihar's Saran reaches 8
48.article_body: The death toll due to consumption of spurious liquor in Chapra in Bihar's Saran district has reached eight. "Medical teams have been sent to the area in the village so that checkups can be done at every household," Saran DM Rajesh Meena said. Reportedly, some people also complained of loss of eyesight after consuming illicit liquor.

49.title: Anti-CAA protests sent wrong message to the world: RSS leader
49.article_body: Senior RSS leader Indresh Kumar said protests against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) at Jamia Millia Islamia sent a wrong message to the world. "When we thought of giving refuge to minorities from a nation which was...part of our country in the past...you should have had the humility to accept them," Kumar said while addressing a seminar at the university.

50.title: Actor Bradley Cooper's 'lookalike' wanted by police for shoplifting in US
50.article_body: Police in US' Henry County are searching for a man accused of shoplifting from a store. The man, who social media users said looked exactly like actor Bradley Cooper, is accused of stealing a Bosch Rotary Laser Kit from the Home depot in McDonough. "Bradley Cooper. I'd know that guy anywhere," a social media user commented on police's post.

51.title: I feel I've got another job: Big B on 22 years as host of Kaun Banega Crorepati
51.article_body: While talking about his 22 years as a host for the show 'Kaun Banega Crorepati', actor Amitabh Bachchan said that he feels like he has got another job. He also spoke about the questions that he asks on the show. "I don't know where [questions] come from but they are researched from various states...then forwarded to master computer," he added.

52.title: 4 US police officers charged over killing of 26-yr-old black woman
52.article_body: US prosecutors have charged four former and current Louisville police officers over a drug raid that led to the death of 26-year-old black woman Breonna Taylor in 2020. Prosecutors alleged that the officers falsified the affidavit used to obtain the search warrant of Taylor's home that led to her killing. Anti-racism protests were sparked in the US following Taylor's death.

53.title: Sec 144 imposed in New Delhi district ahead of Congress' nationwide protest
53.article_body: Section 144 of CrPC has been imposed in the entire New Delhi district, except Jantar Mantar, ahead of the Congress' nationwide protest on Friday. "Protest/dharna/gherao in the area of New Delhi district on August 5 cannot be permitted in view of security, law and order and traffic reasons," Delhi Police said. Congress will hold the protest over unemployment and inflation.

54.title: Waited for this for a very long time: Sreeshankar on historic silver
54.article_body: Having become the first Indian male athlete to win a silver medal in long jump at CWG, Murali Sreeshankar said, "I've...[waited] for this for a very long time. I desperately wanted a medal." Sreeshankar added he's disappointed he couldn't win the gold medal. He registered a best jump of 8.08m, helping India win its second athletics medal at CWG 2022.

55.title: B'wood had same tonality as South, Aamir's the reason we changed: Karan
55.article_body: Talking about Bollywood films struggling recently with movies like 'RRR' doing well, filmmaker Karan Johar told actor Aamir Khan, "There's a tonality that 'KGF'...or 'Pushpa' [have] that...Hindi cinema [had]. We...let go of it and you're responsible." Karan added Aamir starred in films like 'Lagaan' that resulted in a new audience. "You're wrong. Those were...heartland films," responded Aamir.

56.title: Jack Dorsey-led Block to slow hiring, reduce investments amid losses in Q2
56.article_body: Jack Dorsey-led Block has slowed its hiring and will reduce its 2022 investment target by $250 million as it reported a loss in the second quarter with falling Bitcoin prices. Block, which was formerly called Square, witnessed a total net revenue of $4.40 billion, down 6% from a year ago. Shares of Block fell nearly 6% on Thursday.

57.title: Mumbai man fights vendor over juice quantity; assaults constable, home guard
57.article_body: A man who was engaged in a fight with a vendor over being served less quantity of juice on Wednesday, also assaulted and manhandled a constable, Suraj Jadhav, and a home guard. The home guard was sent to spot but was told by the man that he would get him fired. The man also manhandled Jadhav by pulling his collar.

58.title: Live organs transported in 13 mins via green channel in Hyderabad
58.article_body: Hyderabad Traffic Police on Thursday provided a green channel for the transportation of live organs from Yashoda Hospitals in Malakpet to KIMS Hospitals in Begumpet. The traffic police also shared a video of the organs being transported with the hashtag '#SavingLives'. The traffic police tweeted that the distance of 11 km between the hospitals was covered in just 13 minutes.

59.title: Police arrest 8 people for gambling in Hyd, over ₹37,000 cash seized
59.article_body: Hyderabad's Kanchanbagh police on Wednesday arrested eight people on charges of gambling. Based on a tip-off, Sub-Inspector G Linga Raju raided a house in Hafeez Baba Nagar and found the accused playing card games and gambling. An amount of ₹37,620 in cash and a pack of cards were recovered during the raid. All accused are reportedly aged between 28-52 years.

60.title: Prostitution racket busted at Pune spa; 5 arrested, 4 women rescued
60.article_body: Pune City Police's crime branch busted a prostitution racket operating at a spa in the Wanwadi area and arrested two managers of the spa. Police also booked three more persons in the case and rescued four women. The women were allegedly lured into prostitution at the spa. The racket was busted after a decoy customer was sent to the spa.

61.title: 5 police personnel transferred for taking part in beauty pageant in Tamil Nadu
61.article_body: Five police personnel were transferred after they took part in a beauty pageant in Tamil Nadu, officials said on Friday. The transfer orders by the Nagapattinam Superintendent of Police came after the personnel walked the ramp at the beauty pageant. As per reports, the beauty contest was held last Sunday in Mayiladuthurai district by a private organisation.

62.title: 2 persons sexually assault & murder 7-yr-old girl in Pune; arrested
62.article_body: Pune Rural Police have arrested two persons for allegedly kidnapping, sexually assaulting and murdering a seven-year-old girl. The body of the girl, who was kidnapped on August 2, was found after around 18 hours behind a Zilla Parishad school in a village, according to the police. "Within 24 hours after the incident, we've arrested both the accused," an inspector said.

63.title: Dentist at Delhi's Tihar smuggles 82 grams of ganja into prison, held
63.article_body: A dentist at Delhi's Tihar Jail was arrested for allegedly smuggling 82 grams of ganja and some tobacco into the prison, police said on Thursday. He allegedly hid the drugs in his shoes and was frisked, police added. "The dentist had come to visit an inmate...was caught by officials while he was handing over the drugs," police stated.

64.title: Found new ₹2.25 crore trail linked to Sanjay Raut: ED to court
64.article_body: Enforcement Directorate on Thursday said a fresh trail of proceeds of crime of ₹2.25 crore, linked to Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut, has been found in case of redevelopment of a chawl project in Mumbai. ED had said Raut and his family were direct beneficiaries of ₹1.06 crore linked to the case. ED arrested Raut in wee hours of Monday.

65.title: Musk didn't find $44 bn deal attractive after his massive wealth fell: Twitter
65.article_body: Twitter has responded to counterclaims made by Elon Musk over $44 billion buyout deal after the social media company sued him for trying to pull out of the agreement. "[The counterclaims are] a story, imagined in an effort to escape a merger agreement that Musk no longer found attractive once the stock market—and...his massive personal wealth—declined in value," Twitter said.

66.title: Not true: Musk on reports of building a private airport in Texas
66.article_body: Reacting to reports of him building a private airport in Texas, the world’s richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk said that is "not true". He added, "Tesla is five minutes from Austin international airport. [It] would be silly to build another private airport, however, the existing commercial airport needs another runway, as Austin is growing fast!"

67.title: Musk's claim that he was hoodwinked into signing deal is implausible: Twitter
67.article_body: Twitter has filed its response to claims made by the world's richest person Elon Musk that he was "hoodwinked" into signing the deal to buy the company. "According to Musk...the billionaire founder of multiple companies...[he] was hoodwinked by Twitter into signing a $44 billion merger agreement. That story is as implausible and contrary to fact as it sounds," Twitter said.

68.title: Sudhir wins India's first-ever gold medal in para powerlifting in CWG history
68.article_body: India's 27-year-old para powerlifter Sudhir clinched gold medal in the men's heavyweight category, taking India's medal tally at CWG 2022 to 20. It is India's first-ever gold medal in para powerlifting in the history of CWG. Sudhir had a best lift of 212 kg and he finished with 134.5 points in the final, setting a CWG record.

69.title: US declares monkeypox a public health emergency
69.article_body: The US government has declared monkeypox a public health emergency. The US has reported more than 6,600 probable or confirmed cases of the disease since the first case was identified in mid-May. The World Health Organization (WHO) had declared monkeypox a public health emergency of international concern last month.

70.title: Man beats up 2 stray dogs with stick, Pune Police launches probe
70.article_body: The Pune City Police is probing a case in which two stray dogs were severely beaten with a wooden stick in the Wagholi area on July 22. The incident was brought to the notice of the police by an animal welfare activist. The complainant said that the medical examination of the two dogs revealed severe injuries.

71.title: 24-yr-old arms supplier arrested in Delhi, 12 pistols recovered
71.article_body: A 24-year-old arms supplier was arrested along with weapons from Delhi, police said on Thursday. Twelve pistols were recovered from the accused, DCP (Special Cell) Jasmeet Singh said. He had been supplying firearms in Delhi-NCR, Punjab, Haryana and Uttar Pradesh for the last three years, Singh said. He has supplied over 400 firearms in Delhi-NCR in three years, police said.

72.title: Sreeshankar creates history, becomes first Indian man to win silver in long jump at CWG
72.article_body: Long jumper Murali Sreeshankar has created history by becoming the first Indian male athlete to win silver medal in long jump at CWG. The 23-year-old registered a best jump of 8.08m and bagged silver medal in men's long jump event at CWG 2022. It's India's second athletics medal at CWG 2022 after Tejaswin Shankar's bronze in men's high jump event.

73.title: Ukrainian forces exposing civilians to Russian attacks: Report
73.article_body: Ukraine has exposed its civilians to Russian fire as its forces occasionally set up bases in residential and populated areas, Amnesty International said on Thursday. Amnesty said between April and July, Ukraine launched attacks from residential areas in 19 towns. Ukrainian authorities dismissed the rights group's report, calling it “unfair” and a “disinformation and propaganda campaign.”

74.title: Rescue ops intensify to save 10 trapped coal miners in Mexico
74.article_body: Hundreds of people were pressed into service on Thursday to rescue 10 trapped coal mine workers in northern Mexico. The mine collapsed on Wednesday after the miners hit an adjacent area filled with water. While rescuers pumped out water, six special forces scuba divers were set to reach the site later in the day to enter the mine.

75.title: Shuttler Aakarshi reaches CWG pre-quarters after Pak opponent retires due to injury
75.article_body: Indian shuttler Aakarshi Kashyap has reached the women's singles pre-quarterfinals at CWG 2022 after emerging winner of her round of 32 match against Pakistan's Mahoor Shahzad. Aakarshi won the first game 22-20 and was leading 8-1 in the second when Mahoor retired due to an injury. PV Sindhu and Kidambi Srikanth also reached women's singles and men's singles pre-quarterfinals, respectively.

76.title: US, EU, Iran restart Tehran nuclear talks in Vienna
76.article_body: Representatives from Iran, the US and European Union restarted talks over Tehran's nuclear deal on Thursday, as reports claimed the Islamic Republic was expanding uranium enrichment. The Vienna talks are taking place amid growing skepticism, with the EU warning "space for additional significant compromises has been exhausted". The US is not directly communicating with Iran, but through the EU.

77.title: Canada sending military personnel to UK to train Ukrainians
77.article_body: Canadian Defence Minister Anita Anand said the country's military trainers are going to the UK to teach Ukrainians on how to defend against invading Russian forces. As per plans, 225 Canadian Armed Forces personnel will be based in the UK for at least four months. The Canadians will work alongside counterparts from Britain, New Zealand and the Netherlands.

78.title: Gandhi family's record is corrupt, Sonia & Rahul are out on bail: BJP
78.article_body: Amid the National Herald money laundering case, BJP national spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia said on Thursday, "The Gandhi family’s track record is corrupt." "Three members of the family, Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi and Robert Vadra, are out on bail," he added. He alleged that assets worth ₹2,000 crore of Associated Journals Limited were transferred to Young Indian.

79.title: Snakebite victim's brother visits UP for funeral, gets bitten by snake
79.article_body: A 22-year-old man named Govind Mishara travelled from Ludhiana to Uttar Pradesh's Bhawanipur village to attend the last rites of his brother who had died of snakebite on Tuesday. During his visit, Govind died after he himself got being bitten by a snake in his sleep. One of his relatives, who was in the same house, was also bitten.

80.title: Measures like scrapping Article 370 helped J&K's tourism sector: Reddy
80.article_body: Union Minister G Kishan Reddy on Thursday said Jammu and Kashmir reported "record footfall" of tourists in recent months because of "transformative initiatives" like abrogating Article 370. The comments came a day before the third anniversary of the revocation of Jammu and Kashmir's special status. Reddy said over 79 lakh tourists visited the state between October 2021 and March 2022.

81.title: 72-ft tricolour installed in Mussoorie for 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign
81.article_body: The Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) installed a 72-feet-tall national flag at ITBP Academy in Mussoorie, in association with Flag Foundation of India. The installation was done to spread awareness for the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign and is dedicated to the martyrs of the freedom struggle. The 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign is a part of the 76th Independence Day celebrations.

82.title: Johnny Depp drugged me the first time we had sex, claims his ex-girlfriend Ellen Barkin
82.article_body: Newly unsealed court documents reportedly reveal that Johnny Depp's ex-girlfriend, actress Ellen Barkin claimed he was "controlling", drank too much red wine and gave her a quaalude drug the first time they had sex. "He gave me a quaalude and asked...if I wanted to f**k," she was quoted as saying. Ellen was introduced as a witness by Amber Heard's team.

83.title: Fabrication Bazar raises ₹7 crore in a seed funding round
83.article_body: Fabrication Bazar, an engineering startup for manufacturing sectors, has raised ₹7 crore in a seed funding round. The round was led by Inflection Point Ventures, and the funds will be used to expand the team and scale operations to the export market. Founded in 2016 by Dwaipayan Dutta and Mohit Garg, Fabrication Bazar manufactures prefabricated steel products.

84.title: Reliance-backed logistics arm of Dunzo joins ONDC
84.article_body: Reliance-backed Dunzo for Business (D4B), the logistics arm of Dunzo, has joined the Open Network for Digital Commerce (ONDC) for last mile-delivery services. D4B said that the partnership will help local businesses. Dalvir Suri, D4B's head and Dunzo Co-founder said that they will start with key metros and later expand to other cities.

85.title: Do not overreact, no reason to escalate tensions: US to China over Pelosi's Taiwan visit
85.article_body: After China deployed planes and fired live missiles near Taiwan, the US urged China not to overreact to US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan. "There's no reason to react the way that they have or to escalate the tensions," White House national security spokesperson John Kirby said. "Bring down the tensions and work through this," he added.

86.title: Hardik Pandya visits former MI teammate Pollard's house in Caribbean, shares pics
86.article_body: Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya visited his former MI teammate Kieron Pollard's house in the Caribbean. Sharing pictures, he wrote, "No trip to the Caribbean is complete without a visit to the King's home...Polly my favourite and your beautiful family, thank you for hosting me my brother." India are currently playing a five-match T20I series against West Indies.

87.title: 1 migrant labourer killed, 2 injured in grenade attack by terrorists in Pulwama
87.article_body: A migrant labourer died and two others were injured after terrorists hurled a grenade in Gadoora area of Pulwama in Jammu and Kashmir on Thursday. The area has been cordoned off and efforts have been launched to nab the terrorists, said Jammu and Kashmir Police. Both the injured labourers are now stable.

88.title: 73-year-old SP leader Azam Khan admitted to ICU with pneumonia
88.article_body: Senior Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan has been admitted to an ICU of Medanta hospital in Lucknow. The 73-year-old leader, who complained of breathlessness, was found suffering from pneumonia on Wednesday. "[He] has been kept under observation of a critical care team. His condition is stable," a doctor said. SP chief Akhilesh Yadav paid him a visit in the hospital.

89.title: Drugs, ₹2 cr cash recovered in J&K's Udhampur, 1 arrested
89.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir Police have recovered narcotics and cash in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur, officials said. The police have arrested one person in connection to the case and recovered 250 gm of heroin and cash of nearly ₹2 crore in different denominations. A case has been registered under relevant sections and an investigation has been initiated.

90.title: Video of Nikhat wishing her mother on b'day after assuring India of CWG medal goes viral
90.article_body: A video of Indian boxer Nikhat Zareen wishing her mother happy birthday after winning her quarter-final bout and assuring India of a medal at CWG 2022 has gone viral. In the video, Nikhat, who can be seen leaving the boxing ring, says, "Happy birthday ammi...I love you. Allah aapko khush rakhe." Nikhat's semi-final will take place on Saturday.

91.title: Lightning strikes kill 3 in separate incidents in Telangana
91.article_body: Three persons died in lightning strikes amid heavy rains in separate incidents in Telangana's Jayashankar Bhupalpally district. Vanga Ravi, a 48-year-old farmer, died in his farm in Ponugondla village and another farmer, 25-year-old Katam Raghupathi Reddy, was struck by lightning in  Shatrajpally village. Arepalli Varamma, a 56-year-old farmer, was struck by a lightning in Gopalapuram village.

92.title: Ranveer-Alia are this generation's SRK-Kajol: Karan Johar
92.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar said Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt are the present generation's Shah Rukh Khan and Kajol. "When Ranveer and Alia face the camera, you'll see...chemistry because they're buddies, they're friends," Karan said. "That friendship results in chemistry," he added. Alia and Ranveer will be next seen together in 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani', helmed by Karan himself.

93.title: Security forces arrest three militants in J&K's Kupwara
93.article_body: In Jammu and Kashmir's Kupwara district, security forces arrested three militants and recovered arms and ammunition from their possession, the police said. The trio tried to flee a checkpoint at Fruit Mandi Crossing in Handwara, and were arrested, a police spokesperson said. Two of the arrested were identified as Manzoor Ahmed Kumar and Showkat Ahmed Bhat.

94.title: Life expectancy rose by 10 years in Africa from 2000 to 2019: WHO
94.article_body: Africa's healthy life expectancy rose by 10 years from the estimates of 2000 to 2019, the World Health Organization said on Thursday. This is the highest growth in life expectancy in any part of the world for this period. Life expectancy in Africa was 46 years in 2000 and in 2019 it was 56 years, according to WHO Africa.

95.title: NZ MPs urged to delete TikTok over fears China may access data
95.article_body: Members of the New Zealand Parliament have been urged to delete TikTok on their parliamentary phones as it poses a security risk, reports stated. "The parliamentary service strongly recommends you don't use TikTok on your parliamentary service devices as....data on your devices could be accessed by ByteDance [TikTok's owner] and the Chinese government," a parliamentary directive reportedly read.

96.title: Haryana Police arrest illegal arms manufacturer, seize country-made pistols
96.article_body: Haryana Police on Thursday arrested a man from Rajasthan's Bharatpur, who was allegedly involved in manufacturing and selling illegal weapons, a police spokesperson said. At least 48 country-made pistols, 17 cartridges and material used in making weapons were recovered from him. "Apart from making new weapons, he used to repair the old ones for a long time," the spokesperson added.

97.title: Delhi sees over 2,000 new COVID cases for 2nd straight day, positivity rate at 11.84%
97.article_body: Delhi reported 2,202 new COVID-19 cases on Thursday, compared to 2,073 cases recorded the previous day. The city also reported four deaths due to the infection, while the positivity rate rose to 11.84%. This is for the fourth day in a row that the national capital's COVID-19 positivity rate has crossed the 10% mark.

98.title: Ranveer Singh invited to pose nude again for PETA campaign
98.article_body: After Ranveer Singh's nude photoshoot went viral, People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals (PETA) India wrote a letter, inviting him to do a similar photoshoot for them. The organisation requested Ranveer to promote veganism through their campaign. It cited an example of Pamela Anderson, who earlier posed for PETA's 'All Animals Have the Same Parts - Try Vegan' campaign.

99.title: Gujarat leaders Raju Parmar, Naresh Raval quit Congress, to join BJP
99.article_body: Senior Congress leaders from Gujarat, Naresh Raval and Raju Parmar, resigned from the party on Thursday. "We'll join BJP...on August 17," Raval said, adding, "Many of our supporters will also join the BJP on that day." Further, Raval said that he has had many bitter experiences in Congress in the last ten years. This comes ahead of Gujarat Assembly elections.

100.title: Wife, mother of a lawyer shot dead by 4 persons in Haryana's Hansi
100.article_body: The wife and mother of a lawyer, Bunty Yadav, were shot dead on Thursday at his residence in Haryana's Hansi by four unidentified people, police said. The deceased have been identified as 27-year-old Supriya and 62-year-old Geeta Yadav, Bunty Yadav's wife and mother respectively. Bunty Yadav saved his life by locking himself in a room, police added.

101.title: 45 elephants killed in train accidents between 2019 & 2021: Govt
101.article_body: Union Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw in a written reply to a Lok Sabha MP said that 45 elephants were killed in train accidents between 2019 and 2021. Providing statistics of deaths of elephants under different railway zones, Vaishnaw stated, in 2019, 10 elephants were killed and in 2020, 16 elephants died in collision with trains. In 2021,19 elephants were killed.

102.title: Brittney Griner found guilty on drug charges by Russian court, gets 9 years in prison
102.article_body: A Russian court has sentenced US basketball star Brittney Griner to nine years in prison after finding her guilty of deliberately bringing cannabis-infused vape cartridges into Russia despite them being illegal. This comes after a month-long trial and nearly six months after she was arrested at a Moscow-area airport. Griner's time served, since February, will be included in her term.

103.title: IFS officer shares pic of clouded leopard, calls it 'rare beauty'
103.article_body: IFS officer Parveen Kaswan took to Twitter to share a picture of a clouded leopard on the occasion of International Clouded Leopard Day. Calling clouded leopard a "rare beauty", Kaswan stated that the picture was taken at the Buxa Tiger Reserve. "Do you know where else we can find them in India?" he further asked his followers.

104.title: I read Irrfan's medical files & think 'Did I do something wrong?': Sutapa
104.article_body: Irrfan Khan's wife Sutapa said she hasn't been able to part ways with the actor's medical files even two years after his death. "I can't let those medical files go. Every night I...read them...thinking 'Did I do something wrong?'" Sutapa said. She said Irrfan was initially reluctant toward chemotherapy and wanted to live holistic life to deal with his illness.

105.title: Shiv Sena leader booked for using defamatory words against Maha CM
105.article_body: Kavita Gavand, a leader of Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena faction, has been booked for using defamatory language against Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde. According to police, Gavand used inappropriate words on Tuesday while supporters of Thackeray and Shinde clashed with each other over the installation of the photo frame of the CM and his son at Shiv Sena office in Dombivli.

106.title: We have ₹10 lakh cr proposals: Raj govt ahead of investment summit
106.article_body: The Rajasthan government on Thursday said it has arranged investment proposals worth over ₹10 lakh crore covering multiple sectors ahead of the 'Invest Rajasthan 2022’ Summit. Minister Shakuntala Rawat said around 3,000 delegates will attend the event and sessions will be held on start-ups, agriculture and future-ready sectors. The summit will be held on October 7 and 8 in Jaipur.

107.title: Ukraine’s situation not feasible for our students to go back: Govt
107.article_body: The Centre on Thursday said that Ukraine’s ground situation doesn’t permit the return of Indian students to the country. "We have been in touch with educational authorities in Ukraine…[They have] essentially reiterated [their] willingness to continue online courses,” the Centre told the Rajya Sabha. These students can appear in the Foreign Medical Graduate Examination, the government further said.

108.title: 300-year-old sculptures worth crores recovered from deceased smuggler's house in Chennai
108.article_body: Tamil Nadu Idol Wing CID recovered nine stolen sculptures from a house in Broadway in Chennai. The idols, believed to be nearly 300 years old, are estimated to be worth crores of rupees. The house belonged to Pamela Emanuel, wife of late Manuel Pineiro, who was reportedly an idol smuggler. Manuel's family didn't have proper documentation for statues, police said.

109.title: Nisha is dating a man who posed as his 'rakhi brother': Karan Mehra
109.article_body: Actor Karan Mehra has accused his estranged wife Nisha Rawal of having an extramarital affair with a man named Rohit Satia, who posed as her 'rakhi brother' and also performed her 'kanyadaan'. "He's staying at my house with Nisha," Karan said, adding that his son also stays with them, which is morally questionable. Karan claimed Rohit had "physically assaulted" him.

110.title: SEBI seeks clarification from Zomato over 'Eternal' restructuring
110.article_body: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has asked food delivery company Zomato to issue a clarification regarding the 'Eternal' restructuring scheme. CEO Deepinder Goyal in an internal memo said that the company will have multiple CEOs running the different businesses - Zomato, Blinkit, Hyperpure and Feeding India. He further added that the larger organisation would be called 'Eternal'.

111.title: It's fake, says Andhra MP as alleged nude video call with woman goes viral
111.article_body: YSRCP MP Gorantla Madhav has filed a complaint claiming that leaders of Telugu Desam Party (TDP) had morphed his face into a nude video to taint his image. The video, which he claims is "morphed", allegedly shows him having a video call with an unidentified woman. TDP leaders alleged that the MP had sexually harassed the woman in the video.

112.title: CBI raids Odisha businessman Mahimananda's office in ₹25 lakh bribe case
112.article_body: CBI raided the residence and office of Odisha businessman Mahimananda Mishra on Thursday in connection with a bribery case. As per reports, a senior official of Paradip Port Authority is accused of accepting over ₹25 lakh bribe to approve a project to be implemented at the port by Mishra's Odisha Stevedores Limited. Mishra is among the wealthiest persons in Odisha.

113.title: A-listers refused to work with me as I didn't compromise: Mallika Sherawat
113.article_body: Actress Mallika Sherawat said A-list actors refused to work with her as she wouldn't compromise. "If the hero calls you at 3 am and says, 'Come to my house', you have to go...if you are doing that film. If you don't go, you are out of the film," she told Bollywood Hungama. Mallika added she refused to "bow down".

114.title: 'Modishahi' reaching a new low: Cong on Kharge's summoning by ED
114.article_body: Congress on Thursday said that Mallikarjun Kharge's summoning by the ED during the working hours of Parliament was an "insult" to the legislature, alleging that "Modishahi" is reaching a new low. Congress's Digvijaya Singh said that the summoning of the Leader of Opposition in RS by a probe agency during Parliamentary proceedings had never happened in the history of democracy.

115.title: I've never liked living in Hollywood, it's frustrating: Sam Neill
115.article_body: Actor Sam Neill, who took a short break from acting and moved to his farm in New Zealand, said he doesn’t like to stay in Hollywood. “I really like working there...But it’s not a place where I want to live,” Neill said. “What I found frustrating about Hollywood...is that the only thing...people are interested in is...show business,” he said.

116.title: Jadeja deletes his viral comment on CSK's '10 years of Jaddu' tweet, sparks rift rumours
116.article_body: All-rounder Ravindra Jadeja has deleted his viral comment on CSK's '10 years of Jaddu' tweet that was posted by the franchise on February 4, sparking rumours of rift. Jadeja, who had joined the franchise in 2012, had commented, "10 more to go." Earlier, Jadeja had also deleted CSK-related posts from his Instagram account. However, CSK has constantly rubbished rift rumours.

117.title: Sonia, Rahul Gandhi not above law, Cong trying to spread anarchy: BJP
117.article_body: The BJP on Thursday accused Congress of trying to spread "anarchy" and "abusing and intimidating" the ED amid the Opposition party's protests against the agency's action against its leaders in the National Herald case. "Congress leaders are abusing and threatening the investigation agency. Sonia Gandhi and Rahul should know that they are not above the law," BJP's Gaurav Bhatia said.

118.title: UP couple who kidnapped 3-month-old baby arrested, infant rescued
118.article_body: A couple from Uttar Pradesh's Bulandshahr was arrested and the three-month-old baby they had kidnapped on Tuesday was rescued, police said on Thursday. The couple wanted to take the infant to Kolkata to sell it to a needy person. The woman is a Bangladeshi national, a habitual offender and has been married several times, said SSP Manjunath TC.

119.title: Judiciary should 'walk the talk': Mufti after journalist denied bail
119.article_body: Former J&K CM Mehbooba Mufti on Thursday said the judiciary should "walk the talk", as journalist Siddique Kappan was denied bail by the Allahabad High Court. Siddique Kappan was once again denied bail and continues to be behind bars for covering the Hathras gang rape case, she said. Kappan has been booked under UAPA and on charges of sedition.

120.title: Maha ATS arrests Dawood Ibrahim's associate in terror funding case
120.article_body: The Maharashtra Anti Terrorism Squad has arrested an associate of fugitive gangster Dawood Ibrahim in a terror funding case. Parvez Zuber Vaid Memon, who is allegedly involved in "anti-national activities", was picked up from his home in suburban Versova, an official said. The FIR in the matter has also named Dawood's younger brother Anees Ibrahim.

121.title: Over 4,000 cattle die of lumpy skin disease in Rajasthan
121.article_body: Over 4,000 animals, mostly cows, have been killed and another 90,000 were infected by the lumpy skin disease in Rajasthan. Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Thursday appealed to herders to contact veterinary centres if they see signs of the viral disease. "The infection has spread to 16 districts. Barmer, Jodhpur and Jalore are the worst affected," said a senior official.

122.title: Guj doctor fakes kidnapping to exact ₹15 lakh from father to pay gambling debt
122.article_body: A 33-year-old doctor was detained in Ahmedabad on Wednesday for allegedly faking a kidnapping to exact ₹15 lakh in ransom from his father and clear debts he incurred through online gambling. The doctor had also borrowed ₹26.5 lakh from friends after losing money through online gambling. He drove around Ahmedabad in his car while calling his father with ransom demands.

123.title: Fire breaks out in Berlin forest after blast at bomb disposal site
123.article_body: An explosion at a police munitions detonation site in Berlin started a forest fire in the German capital's Grunewald area on Thursday. Officials said there was possibility of more explosions and flying debris from the site. Firefighting efforts were impeded as personnel were forced to maintain a safety distance of 1 km from the flames.

124.title: Actress Upasana Singh sues Harnaaz Sandhu for allegedly breaching film contract
124.article_body: Miss Universe Harnaaz Sandhu, who's set to make her debut in the entertainment industry with Punjabi film 'Bai Ji Kuttange', has been sued by actress-producer Upasana Singh for allegedly not honouring a contract. Upasana claimed that Harnaaz has refused to give dates for the film's promotion despite having signed agreement to make herself available in person and virtually for it.

125.title: Iranian satellite to be launched into orbit by Russian space agency
125.article_body: Russia will place an Iranian remote sensing satellite into orbit on August 9, the Roscosmos space agency said on Wednesday. The announcement of the launch comes weeks after Russian President Vladimir Putin's visit to Iran, during which he met Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi and the country's supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei. Notably, both Russia and Iran are under US sanctions.

126.title: India beat Wales 4-1, reach men's hockey semi-finals at CWG for 4th consecutive time
126.article_body: India defeated Wales 4-1 in their final men's hockey group match to advance to the semi-finals at CWG 2022. India topped Pool B with three victories and a draw. It is the fourth consecutive time that India have reached the men's hockey semi-finals at CWG. Harmanpreet Singh netted a hat-trick in India's 4-1 victory over Wales.

127.title: Bihar SP gets show-cause notice for not producing accused in court in 42-yr-old case
127.article_body: A Bihar sessions court issued Rohtas police superintendent Ashish Bharti a show-cause notice for not producing an accused in a 42-year-old murder case. Calling the offence a serious negligence, Judge Manoj Kumar, asked Bharti to appear in court. However, instead of Bharti, Deputy police superintendent Saroj Kumar Sah appeared in court and pleaded that there was no negligence knowingly.

128.title: Parents should monitor the subjects children are taught in madrasas: Assam CM
128.article_body: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said that parents should keep a watch on what subjects their children are being taught in madrasas. The Jamiul Huda Madrasa in Moirabari was demolished today for links to a Bangladesh-based terror outfit. The CM said, "We have already abolished 800 government madrasas in Assam. But there are many Qawmi madrasas in the state."

129.title: Drug peddler hit by truck while escaping from police in J&K, aide held
129.article_body: A drug peddler was run over by a speeding truck along the Jammu-Srinagar national highway in Udhampur district on Wednesday while he was escaping from the police. His associate, Jagtar Singh, was arrested and ₹1.91 crore cash and 250 grams heroin were seized. "The money appeared to be part of the proceeds of an earlier consignment of narcotics," police said.

130.title: Parts of Great Barrier Reef show highest coral cover in 36 yrs: Report
130.article_body: Parts of Australia's Great Barrier Reef recently showed the highest coral cover in 36 years, scientists said. According to the Australian Institute of Marine Science (AIMS), the average hard coral cover in northern and central regions increased to 36% and 33% in 2021, respectively. Experts, however, warned any recovery could be reversed as coral bleaching continues due to global warming.

131.title: Man beats up 2 stray dogs with stick, Pune Police launches probe
131.article_body: The Pune City Police are probing a case in which two stray dogs were severely beaten with a wooden stick in the Wagholi area on July 22. The incident was brought to the notice of the police by an animal welfare activist. The complainant said that the medical examination of the two dogs revealed severe injuries.

132.title: Constitutional investigative agencies are like toys for BJP: Tejashwi
132.article_body: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Thursday criticised central investigative agencies and said they are like toys for the BJP. "Be it ED, CBI, IT, they unfortunately work as BJP's cells," Yadav said. "It's saddening that all such agencies are working under such tremendous pressure that even fair probe cannot be done," Yadav added.

133.title: Social media platforms creating new challenges for child safety: NCPCR
133.article_body: The National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) said social media platforms are posing new challenges to child safety. "Children are being manipulated on social media platforms, technically known as grooming and these agencies are not ready to cooperate," NCPCR chairperson said. NCPCR claimed these platforms remain ignorant over issues like grooming, phishing and cyber-bullying.

134.title: Which 5 boxers have assured India of medals so far at CWG 2022?
134.article_body: As many as five Indian boxers have reached the semi-finals of their respective categories at CWG 2022, assuring India of medals. Nitu Ghanghas, 21, reached the semi-final of women's minimumweight category, while Mohammad Hussamuddin has reached semi-final of men's featherweight category. Nikhat Zareen, Amit Panghal and Jaismine have also reached the semi-finals of their respective categories.

135.title: 3-yr-old boy found sleeping next to dead mother at railway station in Bihar, pic surfaces
135.article_body: A 35-year-old woman was found dead on a platform of Bihar's Bhagalpur railway station with her 3-year-old boy sleeping next to her, unaware of her demise. The specially-abled child was rescued and handed over to child welfare committee. The woman's body was kept in the mortuary for identification and when her identity couldn't be ascertained, her last rites were performed.

136.title: Who is Romita Shetty, the Indian-origin businesswoman who funded Imran Khan's PTI party?
136.article_body: Pakistan's election commission issued show-cause notice to ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan's PTI party for receiving prohibited funding from foreign nationals, including Indian-origin businesswoman Romita Shetty. Romita is US-based DiMaio Ahmad Capital's MD. She did BA from Delhi's St Stephen's College and Masters from Columbia University. She's the wife of Pakistani-American businessman Nasir Ahmed.

137.title: Govt to conduct compliance audits of social media firms every quarter: Report
137.article_body: Electronics and Information Technology Ministry has decided to conduct compliance audits of social media firms every quarter, PTI reported. Through the audits, the government will reportedly verify if social media companies are reporting about grievances raised by them correctly and if their action taken is in sync with laid out rules. An appellate panel will also reportedly be set up.

138.title: Crypto worth $2 billion stolen from cross-chain bridges in 2022: Report
138.article_body: Cross-chain bridge attacks led to theft of crypto worth $2 billion in 2022 and were responsible for 69% of all crypto losses, according to a report by Chainalysis. The report noted that 13 different token bridge breaches have occurred this year, with the last one being the Nomad Bridge flaw. The January-March quarter witnessed the largest crypto stolen since 2021.

139.title: Scientists successfully revive dead pigs' organs using new technology
139.article_body: Scientists have developed a technology to restore blood circulation and other cell functions in pigs an hour after their death. The technique delivers a specially designed cell-protective fluid to organs and tissues that delay cellular degradation of transplantable organs like heart, liver and kidneys for hours after death. Scientists believe the findings can make more organ transplants possible.

140.title: Autorickshaw driver using his 1st ATM card cheated of ₹34,000 near Mumbai
140.article_body: An autorickshaw driver was cheated at an ATM kiosk in Mira Road near Mumbai on Tuesday. Sushil Sharma had gone to generate a PIN for his first ATM card when a scammer stepped in to help him with the process. He stealthily replaced Sharma's card and later used it and the memorised PIN to withdraw ₹34,000 from Sharma's bank account.

141.title: Video shows sea cucumber eating with tentacle-like structures, Twitter user says 'scary'
141.article_body: Indian Forest Service officer Susanta Nanda has shared a clip of a sea cucumber eating its food. The clip shows the creature being released completely and seconds later, it shows the sea cucumber using its tentacle-like structures to eat. "Scary stuff," a Twitter user commented while another person wrote, "Wonders of nature."

142.title: Shankar has been making pan India films for 30 yrs: Suriya
142.article_body: Praising Tamil filmmaker Shankar for his contribution to Indian cinema, actor Suriya said, "Shankar...showed us what it is to make pan-India films long back. He's been doing it for 30 years." Suriya further said, "The anticipation around his films has been always there. Even now, entire India is looking forward to 'Indian 2' and his next film with Ram Charan."

143.title: E-cigarettes worth ₹15 lakh seized in Hyderabad, 3 arrested
143.article_body: The Hyderabad Commissioner's Task Force (south) on Wednesday arrested three persons from Punjagutta and seized e-cigarettes worth ₹15 lakh from them. Preliminary investigation revealed that the primary accused had stocked e-cigarettes at his residence in Jeedimetla, police said. The accused used to reach out to customers through marketing on Instagram, police added.

144.title: Norway envoy asked to leave Russia after saying 'I hate Russians'
144.article_body: Moscow on Thursday said that a Norwegian diplomat can't stay in Russia after she was filmed uttering "Russophobic remarks" during an outburst at a hotel reception in Murmansk. "I hate Russians...Just give me a room...I'm used to clean rooms, I'm from Scandinavia," Elisabeth Ellingsen, the diplomat, was recorded as saying. Norwegian Foreign Ministry said that it "deeply regretted" the incident.

145.title: OnePlus launches OnePlus 10T 5G starting at ₹49,999
145.article_body: OnePlus has launched the new OnePlus 10T 5G in India. The smartphone offers the latest Snapdragon 8+ Gen 1 processor with 150W fast charging, promising a full charge in 19 minutes, 6.7-inch full HD+ display, Android 12-based OxygenOS 12.1, and more. Available for sale on August 6, it comes in Jade Green and Moonstone Black colour variants starting at ₹49,999.

146.title: Want to work in films with understanding of gender dynamics: Arjun Kapoor
146.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor expressed his wish to work in films with an understanding of gender dynamics. "There's a gender bias created subconsciously in our upbringing. It's up to artistes to break it by doing films...they can ideologically stand by," he said. "I come from a deep-rooted understanding of gender dynamics and want to submit to such stories," he added.

147.title: School bus rams into truck in Mumbai; no casualties reported
147.article_body: A bus of St Mary's School crashed into a truck on Thursday morning in Agripada, Mumbai. The accident occurred after the bus driver was unable to brake while driving on the metal sheets which have been used to cover the road due to some metro work. No casualties were reported as there were no children on board during the accident.

148.title: GHMC collects nearly ₹1,000 crore property tax in 4 months
148.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has collected nearly ₹1,000 crore in property tax in the last four months. The civic body collected ₹997.50 crore by Wednesday, with the revenue being generated from April 1 to August 3. Out of the 9.64 lakh assessments, over 6 lakh property owners paid tax online, a GHMC official said.

149.title: Gujarat teacher hangs self after rape complaint registered against him
149.article_body: A teacher in Gujarat's Chhotaudepur allegedly died by suicide by hanging himself at his home after the mother of a 14-year-old mute and differently-abled girl registered a rape complaint against him. The mother alleged that the teacher had raped her daughter when she was alone at home. The teacher was absconding since the complaint was registered last week.

150.title: Sikh body approves Aamir Khan’s look & character in 'Laal Singh Chaddha'
150.article_body: The Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee gave its nod to Aamir Khan starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha', in which the actor plays a Sikh character. Aamir will be seen donning a beard and turban in the movie, set in Punjab. "I was very touched by the reaction of [SGPC] members...I'm so glad that our film touched their hearts so deeply," Aamir said.

151.title: Seems like a pat on his back: HC on Baba Ramdev's Coronil clarification
151.article_body: Delhi HC said Baba Ramdev's clarification on Coronil "seems to be more like a pat" on his back and granted him another opportunity to present an "appropriate" draft clarification. The HC was hearing a suit filed by a group of doctors' associations over Ramdev's statements against allopathy during the COVID-19 pandemic. Ramdev had claimed Coronil is the cure against COVID-19.

152.title: Sri Lanka is committed to 'One China' policy: Prez Wickremesinghe
152.article_body: Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe on Thursday reaffirmed Sri Lanka's commitment to the 'One China' policy. Countries must refrain from provocations that escalate global tensions, Wickremesinghe said after meeting China's Ambassador to Sri Lanka Qi Zhenhong. His remarks come after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi concluded her visit to Taiwan, over which China had warned US of consequences.

153.title: Vote without fear: Alva tells MPs ahead of Vice Presidential polls
153.article_body: Opposition's Vice Presidential candidate Margaret Alva on Thursday urged members of the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha to cast their votes for their preferred candidate without fear in the upcoming Vice Presidential elections. "The VP election on August 6 is not subject to party whip and is by secret ballot...MPs are expected to vote without...political pressure," she said.

154.title: Pune autorickshaw unions to go on strike as CNG price rises by ₹6/kg
154.article_body: Autorickshaw unions in Pune and Pimpri-Chinchwad areas have decided to go on a half-day strike on August 9. They also plan to hold protests outside MP Girish Bapat's office. This comes after the price of compressed natural gas (CNG) increased by ₹6 per kg in Pune. The unions are also demanding to revise the auto fare as per new rates.

155.title: Toilet commode collapses in Thane, injures 22-yr-old pregnant woman
155.article_body: A 22-year-old pregnant woman was injured after the commode of a public toilet collapsed in the Kalyan-Dombivali area of Thane district on Thursday morning, a civic official said. "The commode collapsed into the septic tank. The woman tried to come out of the tank but finally was pulled out by others who heard her cries," the official added.

156.title: Raid at another Kolkata flat linked to Partha Chatterjee, Arpita Mukherjee
156.article_body: The ED is conducting a search at an apartment in South Kolkata today, linked to the teacher recruitment scam, in which Partha Chatterjee and his aide, Arpita Mukherjee, have been arrested. A locksmith was called in as the apartment at the Fort Oasis complex was locked. Since the arrests in July, the ED has recovered around ₹50 core in cash.

157.title: Mysterious loud sound heard across Punjab's Ludhiana twice today
157.article_body: A mysterious loud sound was heard across Punjab's Ludhiana at least twice today, with locals wondering what it was. Several locals suspected it to be a sonic boom. One of the residents wrote on social media, "The building trembled a little bit too." Another wrote, "It was like something big hit my house roof."

158.title: 2 minor girl inmates escape from state-run home in Kerala, traced
158.article_body: Two minor girl inmates of the state-run Nirbhaya Home in Kerala's Kozhikode allegedly escaped in the early hours of Thursday. Police sources said the two were traced from a nearby area and brought back to the shelter by 11 AM. Six girls, including two sisters, had reportedly escaped from the children's home, housed in the same compound, in late January.

159.title: Bengaluru-based company's ₹40.14 cr assets attached in money laundering probe
159.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has provisionally attached the assets of Bengaluru-based Kavveri Telecom Infrastructure Limited worth ₹40.14 crore under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act, 2002. The ED initiated probe based on an FIR filed by the CBI in 2017. A former deputy general manager of Dena Bank has accused the company's directors of cheating with regard to bank loans.

160.title: More than 10,000 startups registered in 2022: Piyush Goyal
160.article_body: Union Minister of Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal announced that India has over 75,000 startups. The Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT), in a press release, said that the latest 10,000 startups were registered in the last 156 days. It took 808 days for the first 10,000 startups to be registered in India.

161.title: 4 teenage boys drown in a water-filled quarry in MP's Mandsaur
161.article_body: Four teenage boys drowned in a water-filled quarry in Madhya Pradesh's Mandsaur district on Wednesday afternoon, police said. The deceased, aged around 16-17 years, were on their way to a coaching class, but changed plans and decided to step into the quarry filled with rainwater, police said. The boys tried to alert passers-by, but drowned by the time help arrived.

162.title: Dabur Q1 net profit rises at ₹441 crore, revenue jumps 8.07%
162.article_body: Dabur India Limited on Thursday reported a marginal increase in consolidated net profit at ₹441.06 crore for the quarter ended June as against ₹438.30 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. The FMCG major's revenue from operations was up 8.07% to ₹2,822.43 crore. The shares of Dabur India closed at ₹573.95 at the National Stock Exchange.

163.title: 16-year-old 'possessed' girl beheads 7-year-old niece in Raj
163.article_body: A 16-year-old girl beheaded her 7-year-old niece under the influence of the "possession" of a supernatural entity, reports said. According to her family members, the girl's voice and behaviour changed during a ritualistic procedure in the house. She started screaming and suddenly picked up a sword and beheaded her niece, the family members added.

164.title: 56 Kanwariyas injured after bus rams into truck in Bihar's Gopalganj
164.article_body: As many as 56 Kanwariyas reportedly sustained injuries on Thursday after their bus collided with a stationary truck in Bihar's Gopalganj district. The accident occurred when a tanker took a steep turn while overtaking the bus, making the driver lose control of bus. The devotees were on their way to Jharkhand's Deoghar to offer Ganga Jal on the 'Shiva Ling'.

165.title: Bank of England raises interest rate to 1.75% in biggest increase in 27 years
165.article_body: The Bank of England has raised interest rates by 0.5 percentage points to 1.75% in the biggest increase in 27 years. The base rate has been raised for the sixth consecutive time. UK's inflation had increased to 9.4% in June. The cost-of-living crisis will continue throughout next year and only begin to ease in 2024, the bank's forecast read.

166.title: Saddened & shocked: 'Batgirl' directors as the movie gets shelved
166.article_body: A day after the news broke that 'Batgirl' will not be released either theatrically or on HBO Max, directors of the film, Adil El Arbi and Bilall Fallah, said they are shocked and saddened by the news. "As directors, it's critical that our work be shown to audiences...we wish...fans...would have had the opportunity to see...the final film," they stated.

167.title: Google removed over 1.11 lakh harmful content pieces in India in June
167.article_body: Google removed 1,11,493 harmful pieces of content in June in accordance with the new India IT Rules, 2021. According to Mashable, a majority of the content was removed due to copyright infringement, with the rest of the removed content falling under categories like trademarks, court orders, explicit sexual material, among others. Google received 32,717 complaints about external content in June.

168.title: B'luru woman alleges rape by 8 men in church 12 years ago, files FIR
168.article_body: A 21-year-old girl from Bengaluru filed an FIR after 12 years in the Shivaji Nagar Police Station that eight people had raped her in a church when she was ten years old. The woman revealed that after having been sexually assaulted by the two accused, she went to the secretary of Antioch House of Worship, who also assaulted her.

169.title: A disgrace: Bangladesh's Team Director on T20I series loss vs Zimbabwe
169.article_body: Bangladesh's Team Director Khaled Mahmud termed his team's T20I series loss against Zimbabwe as a "disgrace", adding that losing was "quite unusual". "Nobody even tried to hit a six...They batted like [they were] trying to protect their place," stated Mahmud. "If you can't pull a short ball for six, that's going to be a problem...I am very disappointed," he said.

170.title: Tencent seeks to raise stake in 'Assassin's Creed' maker Ubisoft: Report
170.article_body: Tencent plans to raise its stake in French video game maker Ubisoft, Reuters reported. Tencent, which bought a 5% stake in Ubisoft in 2018, has reached out to the French firm's founding Guillemot family and expressed interest in increasing its stake in the firm. Tencent reportedly aims to become the single largest shareholder of Ubisoft with the additional stake purchase.

171.title: Probing claims of Sikh migrants' turbans being seized at Mexico border: US
171.article_body: US authorities are investigating claims that turbans of nearly 50 Sikh migrants were seized after they were detained along the country's border with Mexico, reports stated. "We take allegations of this nature very seriously," Customs and Border Protection (CBP) Commissioner Chris Magnus reportedly said. "Our expectation is that CBP employees treat all migrants...with respect," Magnus added.

172.title: Gold prices in India rise, trade at ₹51,815 per 10 gram
172.article_body: Following positive global cues, gold prices in India traded higher on Thursday at ₹51,815 per 10 gram. Gold October futures traded higher by ₹461 at ₹51,850 per 10 gram on the Multi Commodity Exchange. Silver September futures rose ₹57,880 per kg. A pullback in the US dollar and Treasury yields led gold prices to edge higher globally.

173.title: To have a child at 29 is Alia's coolest, bravest decision: Kareena
173.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan has lauded Alia Bhatt's decision of embracing motherhood at the age of 29. "I think it's the bravest and coolest decision for Alia," Kareena said. "She...stood up for the most beautiful [feeling], which is, 'I want to have a child with the man I love'," Kareena added. Alia Bhatt announced her pregnancy in June 2022.

174.title: Never wished to be an actor, wanted to become an IAS officer: Annu Kapoor
174.article_body: Actor Annu Kapoor, who has been working in the entertainment industry for over four decades, said he never wished to be an actor and wanted to become an IAS officer instead.
