He told HT that his parents did not have the financial background to support his dreams. Hence, he ended up joining his father's theatre company to support his family.

175.title: Govt doesn't interfere in workings of law agencies in country: Union Minister
175.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Thursday told Rajya Sabha that Centre doesn't interfere in the workings of law agencies in the country. His statement came after Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge raised a question regarding his ED summon, saying, "Is it suitable for ED to summon me while Parliament session is ongoing?" This was being done to demoralise Opposition, he added.

176.title: Horrible 'raj' going on in country: Cong MP on ED summon to Kharge
176.article_body: Reacting to the ED summon sent to Congress’ Mallikarjun Kharge, party MP KC Venugopal said that horrible "raj" is going on in the country. "There are parliamentary systems. We are law-abiding citizens but when the Parliament is in session and LoP (Kharge) is participating in a debate, ED is summoning him at 12:30 [pm]. What is the point?" Venugopal asked.

177.title: He had no work at Hathras: HC as it rejects bail plea of journalist Siddique
177.article_body: Allahabad High Court has rejected the bail plea of journalist Siddique Kappan, who was booked under Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act. Kappan was arrested in 2020 when he was on his way to meet the Hathras gang-rape victim's family. Denying him bail, the court said, "[He] had no work at Hathras." Police had accused him of intending to create communal disharmony.

178.title: USFDA gives approval to Zydus Lifesciences to market skin cream
178.article_body: The US Food and Drug Administration (USFDA) has given Zydus Lifesciences Limited the approval to market its generic version of the Ivermectin cream used to treat inflammatory skin disease. Inflammatory lesions of rosacea is a common skin condition that causes redness of the skin and small bumps on the face. The cream will be manufactured at Zydus Lifesciences' Ahmedabad facility.

179.title: IndiGo to let passengers disembark from three doors of aircraft
179.article_body: IndiGo airline on Thursday said that it will start a three-point disembarkation process allowing passengers to deboard the aircraft faster upon arrival at the airport. The disembarkation process will be carried out from two forward and one rear exit ramp. Initially, this will be implemented at Delhi, Mumbai and Bengaluru airports on IndiGo's A320 and A321 fleet, the airline said.

180.title: Himachal Pradesh BJP vice-president Praveen Sharma passes away aged 65
180.article_body: Himachal Pradesh BJP vice-president Praveen Sharma died on Thursday morning aged 65. Sharma, who was the vice chairman of Himachal Pradesh Housing and Urban Development Authority (HIMUDA), died at his residence in Amb town. He was elected from the Amb Assembly constituency in 1998 and had also served as Excise and Taxation-cum-Youth Welfare and Sports Minister.

181.title: Rejected OTT shows due to abusive words, sexual content: Kiran Karmarkar
181.article_body: Actor Kiran Karmarkar, known for portraying 'Om Agarwal' in 'Kahaani Ghar Ghar Kii', said he was offered several shows for OTT platforms, but they didn't work. "I didn't like the content of some shows. Also, in some of them, I found...sexual content and abusive words that were used very [unnecessarily]," he added. The actor will be next seen in 'Darlings'.

182.title: We look up to Mirabai for inspiration: Pak weightlifter who lifted 405 kg to win CWG gold
182.article_body: Pakistani weightlifter Muhammad Nooh Dastgir Butt, who lifted a total of 405 kg to win gold in men's 109+ kg category at CWG 2022, said it was a proud moment for him when Mirabai Chanu congratulated him. "We look up to Mirabai for inspiration," he added. "She has shown us...we from...South Asian countries can also win...Olympic medal," he stated.

183.title: Akshay Kumar's 'Raksha Bandhan' gets rare ‘U’ certificate
183.article_body: The Censor Board has cleared Akshay Kumar starrer 'Raksha Bandhan' with a 'U' certificate. Films are usually given a 'U/A' certificate, where viewing for children below 12 years requires parental guidance, but for 'U' certificate movies, viewing is completely unrestricted. "For me, [it's]...a personal victory. I got down to making a clean family entertainer," director Aanand L Rai said.

184.title: Bharti Airtel to roll out 5G services this month, signs equipment deals
184.article_body: Bharti Airtel has signed 5G equipment service deals with Ericsson, Nokia and Samsung, and will start rolling out 5G services later this month, the telecom operator said. Bharti Airtel acquired 19,867.8 MHz spectrum worth ₹43,084 crore in the country's first-ever 5G spectrum auction. "Airtel will work with the best technology partners from across the world," its MD and CEO said.

185.title: ISRO provides aid of ₹50 lakh each to six startups for R&D
185.article_body: The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) provided financial aid of ₹50 lakh each to six startups, Minister of State of Science & Technology said in a written reply in the Lok Sabha. The aid was provided for research and development under the ANIC-ARISE 1.0 programme announced in 2020. The Minister added that 24 startups applied of which six were selected.

186.title: 22-year-old COVID positive burglar escapes from hospital in Mumbai
186.article_body: A 22-year-old burglar, Nazim Ayub Khan, allegedly escaped from Mumbai's Kasturba Hospital as he was admitted there after testing positive for COVID-19. Khan was arrested on July 30 and tested positive for COVID-19 during a mandatory check, police said. "We've checked the CCTV footage in which the accused can be seen running through the back door," police added.

187.title: 32-yr-old carpenter loses ₹2.98 lakh to cyber fraud in Navi Mumbai
187.article_body: A 32-year-old carpenter in Navi Mumbai was allegedly cheated of ₹2.98 lakh while trying to know why ₹1,100 was debited from his bank account. The complainant searched for a customer care number and called a toll-free number. However, the call was disconnected and he received a call from the fraudster, who asked him to install an app and cheated him.

188.title: Tejaswin, who won historic CWG medal for India, fought court case to feature in CWG
188.article_body: High jumper Tejaswin Shankar, who became the first-ever Indian to win a medal in high jump in CWG history, had fought a court case to be included in CWG. He wasn't included initially despite achieving the qualification mark. He moved Delhi High Court against Athletics Federation of India (AFI), who later included him as a replacement for Arokia Rajiv.

189.title: ED kept me in a room without windows and ventilation: Sanjay Raut to court
189.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut, who was arrested in a money laundering case, told a court the ED kept him in a room without windows and ventilation. The ED said there was no window because he was kept in an AC room but Raut said he cannot use AC. The ED then assured he'd be kept in a ventilated room.

190.title: It'll displace the market: Hogg on IPL sides buying teams in T20 leagues
190.article_body: Reacting to IPL franchises purchasing teams in global T20 leagues, ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said, "It's going to displace the marketplace in certain phases." "You lose track of who actually is in your franchise," added Hogg. Former Australian cricketer Adam Gilchrist had earlier stated that he is concerned about IPL's monopolisation of global T20 leagues, terming it "dangerous".

191.title: Assam is becoming hotbed of 'jihadi activities': Assam CM Sarma
191.article_body: CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Thursday said that Assam has become a hotbed of "jihadi activities", with five modules having links with Bangladesh-based terror outfit Ansarul Islam busted in five months. Indoctrination of Muslim youths in private madrasas by Imams from outside the state is alarming, he said. "Jihadi activity is very different from terrorist or insurgency activities," Sarma added.

192.title: ED summons Sanjay Raut's wife Varsha Raut in Patra Chawl money laundering case
192.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Thursday summoned Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut's wife Varsha Raut in connection with the Patra Chawl money laundering case. The summons was issued after transactions done on her account came to light, ED said. The law enforcement agency claimed that an amount worth ₹1.08 crore was received in the account of Varsha from unrelated persons.

193.title: Facebook to remove live shopping from Oct 1 and focus on Reels
193.article_body: Social media giant Facebook has decided to shut live shopping feature from October 1. Facebook said that it will focus on Reels for its main application and Instagram because consumers' viewing behaviours are shifting towards short-form videos. Users will be able to broadcast events on Facebook Live but they will not be able to tag products or create product playlists.

194.title: Reservation list for BBMP polls released; 81 seats for OBCs
194.article_body: The BBMP has released the reservation list for Scheduled Tribes (STs), Scheduled Castes (SCs) and Other Backward Classes (OBCs) for the upcoming elections to the civic body. As per the draft notification, 81 seats were reserved for OBCs, 28 for SCs and four for STs. Of all 243 seats, 50% have been reserved for women candidates in each category.

195.title: 3 of migrant workers' family from MP found dead in house in Telangana
195.article_body: At least three members of a family of migrant workers from Madhya Pradesh were found dead in a house in Telangana's Sangareddy district, police said. The deceased include a 28-year-old woman, her two-year-old daughter and her husband's 27-year-old cousin, police added. The woman and the 27-year-old man were in an intimate relationship, police further said.

196.title: Rejected international projects to prioritise my family: Anil Kapoor
196.article_body: Anil Kapoor revealed in an interview that he was offered many international shows, however, he rejected them to prioritise his family. "Sometimes, shows need a lot of your time. Then you have to make...choice," the actor added. He further said that he takes his family's consent if it's a big project. "If they say yes, I do it," he added.

197.title: US-based Product10x plans to enter India to help startups raise funds
197.article_body: US-based company Product10x is planning to enter India this year with an aim to help pre-seed, seed and Series A startups scale up and raise funds. Product10x is a software-as-a-service (SaaS) focused accelerator which has helped startups secure over $10 million funding in past three years. It has 16 companies in its portfolio out of which two are in India.

198.title: Adani Wilmar's Q1 net profit rises by 10% due to higher sales
198.article_body: Adani Wilmar Limited on Wednesday reported a 10% growth in consolidated net profit to ₹193.59 crore for the quarter ended June as against ₹175.70 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. The company attributed the growth to higher sales. MD and CEO Angshu Mallick said the company witnessed double-digit growth in sales through e-commerce and modern trade.

199.title: Sanjay Raut will never do any corruption, BJP is scared of him: Sunil Raut
199.article_body: After a Mumbai court extended ED custody of Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut till August 8, his brother Sunil Raut said BJP is scared of Sanjay. "We have faith in judiciary…Sanjay Raut is a true Shiv Sainik of Balasaheb Thackeray, he will never do any corruption," Sunil added. The Shiv Sena leader has been arrested in Patra Chawl money-laundering case.

200.title: Pune woman harassed for rejecting man's proposal on matrimonial site
200.article_body: Pune Police have launched a probe to find a man accused of sexually harassing a 29-year-old woman after she rejected his proposal on a matrimonial site. The accused, who is a resident of Mumbai, allegedly demanded sexual favours from the woman and sent defamatory messages to her relatives and friends online after she rejected his proposal, police said.

201.title: Jason Momoa turns flight attendant, hands out water aboard Hawaii flight
201.article_body: Actor Jason Momoa turned into a flight attendant and surprised passengers aboard a flight in Hawaii on Tuesday. A video showing Jason pushing the snack cart and handing out water bottles to the passengers has gone viral on social media. The water bottles, however, belonged to a brand, created by Jason himself. "His marketing team is genius," a user commented.

202.title: Anushka to undergo cricket training in UK's Leeds for 'Chakda Xpress'
202.article_body: Actress Anushka Sharma will reportedly undergo cricket training in Leeds, UK, from mid-August to prepare herself thoroughly before shooting intensive cricket portions of 'Chakda Xpress'. Anushka will portray the role of women cricket's all-time greatest fast bowler Jhulan Goswami in the film. "She is leaving no stone unturned to become Jhulan on screen," a source, as quoted by Pinkvilla, said.

203.title: Samsung scales back production in Vietnam as demand falls: Reports
203.article_body: Samsung Electronics has cut down production at a smartphone plant in Vietnam as retailers and warehouses deal with increasing inventory amid global fall in consumer spending, reports said. US retailers like Best Buy, Target Corp warn of slowing sales. Plant workers said they are shifting to three-day and four-day work week as six-day work week and overtime is not needed.

204.title: 2 doctors booked for death of woman, baby after C-section in Mumbai
204.article_body: Two doctors have been booked for the death of a woman and her newborn baby following a  botched C-section at a civic-run hospital in Mumbai's Ghatkopar in 2016. Dr Megha Dharmdasari and Dr Prabjyot Manchanda, accused of lapses during the Caesarean procedure, have been booked for causing death by negligence and common intention. "The doctors...were residential medical officers," police said.

205.title: Hope something works out: Naga Chaitanya on his meeting with Bhansali
205.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya, who was recently spotted at filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali's office, said he was there for "just casual meetings", adding that he hopes "something works out". "These are filmmakers I have looked up to, so just [paying] respects," he stated. Chaitanya will soon make his Hindi film debut with 'Laal Singh Chaddha' alongside Aamir Khan.

206.title: Lenovo, Acer, Motorola to face probe over alleged patent violation
206.article_body: The US International Trade Commission said that it will investigate companies including Lenovo, Motorola and Acer over a complaint of violation of a US law. The companies have been accused of selling certain video devices and products that violate patents. The tech firms could be blocked from importing certain gadgets if the ITC confirms infringement of four patents.

207.title: We’ll take all account of loot in Delhi, H’yana: Khattar on National Herald case
207.article_body: Commenting on the National Herald case, Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar said that Congress has already "looted" Haryana. "We are going to take all the account of this loot from them here (in Delhi) and in Haryana as well," CM Khattar added. The ED on Wednesday sealed the Congress-owned National Herald office.

208.title: Venture capital firm AWE Funds launches India fund worth ₹350 crore
208.article_body: To promote gender equity, gender-focused venture capital firm Achieving Women Equity (AWE) Funds has launched a maiden fund for India for ₹350 crore. The US-based fund is looking to invest in 15 startups across healthcare, climate and sustainability, food and agri, education, and fintech sectors over the next five years. AWE claims to have invested ₹2,800 crore, to date.

209.title: 2 members of 'Namaste gang' arrested after encounter with police in Delhi
209.article_body: Two members of the 'Namaste gang' have been arrested following a brief encounter in Delhi's Shahdara area, police said on Thursday. The gang's members used to greet victims with 'namaste' before and after looting them. Police had set a trap to catch the criminals when they opened fire, with one policeman surviving a narrow escape due to his bulletproof jacket.

210.title: Free entry at Charminar, Golconda Fort in Hyderabad from August 5 to15
210.article_body: Monuments protected by the Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) will have free entry for all visitors from August 5 to 15. This comes amid the 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav' to celebrate 75 years of independence of India. The ASI sites in Hyderabad and Warangal that will have free entry include Archaeological Site Museum, Kondapur, Charminar, Golconda Fort and Warangal Fort.

211.title: 2 men pose as pilots to obtain US visa, booked by Delhi Police
211.article_body: The Delhi Police have registered a case against a 19-year-old man and his father for allegedly posing as pilots and forging documents to obtain US visas. During an interview with the US Embassy officials, Keshav (19-year-old accused) confessed he had lied about his pilot training certificate, adding that his DGCA exam reports and financial documents were all fake, police said.

212.title: US-based Paystand, Mexico's Yaydoo merge to make blockchain platform
212.article_body: US-based Paystand and Mexico-based Yaydoo on Wednesday announced a merger to facilitate a blockchain platform. The platform will aim to help businesses around the US and Latin America with liquidity solutions and cashflow management. Without disclosing details, the tech startups said in a statement that the deal forms a B2B fintech unicorn.

213.title: ICMR lab in Pune conducts 100 sample tests for monkeypox amid outbreak
213.article_body: Amid rising cases of monkeypox in India, Indian Council of Medical Research's (ICMR) Viral Research and Diagnostic Laboratories (VRDL) in Pune has conducted 100 tests for the outbreak till Wednesday morning. "We don't have any samples pending for testing as of now. Sample testing is a continuous process and it is being processed," a senior scientist at ICMR-NIV said.

214.title: DNA test gets UP man arrested for raping minor girl 28 years ago
214.article_body: A man in Uttar Pradesh was arrested 28 years after he and his brother allegedly raped a minor girl when his DNA matched with the boy born as a result of the crime, police said. Superintendent of Police Sanjay Kumar said a 12-year-old girl was allegedly raped by the two accused in 1994. The accused's brother is still absconding.

215.title: Cyberattack on Spanish research body likely originated from Russia: Govt
215.article_body: Spain's Science Ministry said the country's leading scientific research body was targeted by a cyberattack that authorities suspect had its origin in Russia. It appears no sensitive or confidential information was extracted, as per a preliminary analysis by cybersecurity authorities. The attack was similar to others carried out against NASA and Germany's Max Planck Institute, the Ministry said.

216.title: Twid raises $12 mn in Series A round to focus on tech, recruitment
216.article_body: Twid, a reward point-based payment platform, announced that it has secured $12 million in a Series A funding round. The round, led by Rakuten Capital, was joined by Google, ICMG Partners, Reddy Futures Fund and existing investors. The Fintech platform, founded in 2020, said it will use the capital to build tech capabilities, recruit people and expand product roll-outs.

217.title: 1.29 crore votes cast for NOTA in last 5 years: Poll rights body
217.article_body: About 1.29 crore votes were cast for NOTA (None of the above) option in the last five years in various elections, Association for Democratic Reforms (ADR) said. On average, NOTA secured 64.53 lakh votes in state Assembly elections, according to the ADR report. Among NOTA votes in Lok Sabha polls, the highest number was in Bihar's Gopalganj (SC) at 51,660.

218.title: Bengaluru's Lalbagh flower show opens tomorrow
218.article_body: Bengaluru's Lalbagh Botanical Garden's annual flower show will open on Friday with officials expecting a footfall of 10-15 lakh people over the next 10 days. The show is taking place after a gap of two years due to the COVID-19 pandemic and this year's theme is based on Kannada film stars Dr Rajkumar and his son Puneeth Rajkumar.

219.title: Nayanthara texted, 'Best of luck & rooting for you': Janhvi on 'Good...'
219.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor said that she asked for Nayanthara's number after the latter praised Janhvi and the trailer of 'Good Luck Jerry'. "I messaged her and said 'thank you...it means a lot to me'," she said. Janhvi added, "She actually replied which was very exciting to me and she said...'best of luck and rooting for you'."

220.title: It was Kohli's call purely, he decided he doesn't want to captain: BCCI Treasurer Dhumal
220.article_body: BCCI Treasurer Arun Dhumal, in an interview with veteran sports journalist Vimal Kumar, said that it was Virat Kohli's call "purely" to leave captaincy. "He decided that he doesn't want to captain India anymore...We respected his decision," Dhumal added. "We want that he returns to form soon," he further said.

221.title: USFDA flags quality, procedural lapses at Biocon's Hyderabad facility
221.article_body: United States Food and Drug Administration (USFDA) had flagged quality control and procedural lapses at Biocon's Hyderabad facility in a pre-approval inspection on July 20. "Three observations were cited...which we'll be addressing within the stipulated time," Biocon had said. The observations include deficient lab control mechanisms and failure to control critical storage parameters, etc.

222.title: For people in the cinema, theatres are our temples: Actor Prabhas
222.article_body: Actor Prabhas, while promoting Dulquer Salmaan's 'Sita Ramam', has said some films are meant to be watched in theatres. "The budget which the producers spent and the scale [on 'Sita Ramam'] is huge. For example, do we stop going to the temple because there's a pooja room at home? For people in the cinema, theatres are our temples," he added.

223.title: Present-day cricket is a topical point, it has become an issue: Smith
223.article_body: Ex-South Africa captain Graeme Smith said present-day cricket is a topical point and has become an issue that needs to be looked at. "Talking of bilateral cricket...it's becoming packed now. Look at the next seven years, you have seven world events, the calendars are getting tight and it's not easy to figure this all out," added Smith.

224.title: Bookie arrested for taking bets on India-West Indies T20I match in Pune
224.article_body: Pimpri-Chinchwad Police have arrested an alleged bookie for taking bets on T20I cricket match between India and West Indies. Vinayak Shelar, 50, was arrested after police raided a flat in Pune's Mohan Nagar area following a tip-off. Six cell phones and an internet router were seized from Shelar. Police said they've launched a probe into a suspected cricket betting racket.

225.title: Son gives phone without SIM to mother; abandons her at temple in K'taka
225.article_body: A son abandoned his 80-year-old mother at a temple after giving her a mobile phone without a SIM card in Karnataka's Koppal district, police said. The man also gave her a sheet of paper saying that he has written his mobile phone number on it but purportedly it was an empty sheet of paper, police added.

226.title: 5 girls beat 13-yr-old outside school in Delhi, post video on Insta
226.article_body: A 13-year-old school student in Delhi was allegedly dragged and beaten up by a group of her seniors outside her school, the police said on Thursday. The incident took place on Wednesday and the students posted a video of the incident on Instagram, which shows the minor being dragged by her hair and thrashed by four to six girls.

227.title: Took up projects I didn't like only to run my kitchen: Annu Kapoor
227.article_body: Actor Annu Kapoor said at times he had to take up projects for money even though he didn't like the content. Annu said he feels "frustrated" from inside but can't do anything about it, adding, "I have to run the kitchen." "I'm not Amitabh Bachchan or Shah Rukh Khan or Salman Khan, I'm just a very small...struggling actor," he added.

228.title: No line, length or pace can keep Suryakumar Yadav quiet: Manjrekar
228.article_body: Former India batter Sanjay Manjrekar tweeted that Indian cricketer Suryakumar Yadav's growth as a batter in the last five years has been "phenomenal". "Few years back flick over square leg was his one 'go to' shot. Now, he has several," added Manjrekar. "There isn't a length or line or certain pace that can keep him quiet," he stated.

229.title: ‘Modishahi’ reaching new lows: Cong’s Jairam on ED summon to Kharge
229.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Thursday reacted to the ED summon sent to party leader Mallikarjun Kharge. "Mallikarjun Kharge, Leader of Opposition in Rajya Sabha, was summoned by the ED when Parliament [was] in session. He, of course, left around 12:20 pm and presented himself. This is Modishahi reaching new lows," Ramesh tweeted.

230.title: Didn't think Bhuvneshwar has an int'l career 18 months back: Manjrekar
230.article_body: Talking about Bhuvneshwar Kumar, ex-India batter Sanjay Manjrekar said, "18 months back, we thought he may not have an international career." Manjrekar added Bhuvneshwar has bounced back superbly and is certain to be a part of the T20 World Cup 2022 squad. "India keep going back to Bhuvneshwar...If you compare Bhuvneshwar and Arshdeep Singh, [the latter's]...much better," Manjrekar had stated.

231.title: GST imposed on 'Sarais' reminds of 'jizya tax' during Mughal rule: AAP MP
231.article_body: AAP MP Raghav Chadha met Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Thursday and demanded removal of 12% GST on 'Sarais' (inns) meant for devotees visiting Golden Temple in Amritsar, Punjab. Chadha said that tax on 'Sarais' reminds us of 'jizya tax' imposed during the Mughal era. "I have also demanded a financial package for Punjab," he added.

232.title: Ghosal breaks down after winning historic CWG medal for India by defeating best friend
232.article_body: Saurav Ghosal broke down after becoming the first Indian squash player to win a singles' medal in CWG history. The 35-year-old defeated his best friend James Willstrop of England in the bronze medal match. A video surfaced online showing Ghosal breaking down as the crowd applauded him for his win. India have bagged 18 medals at CWG 2022 so far.

233.title: Chandigarh-bound Go First flight diverted to Ahmedabad after bird hit
233.article_body: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has informed that the Go First flight G8911 operating today from Ahmedabad to Chandigarh was diverted back to Ahmedabad due to a bird hit. It comes a day after a car belonging to Go First airline went under an IndiGo aircraft at the Delhi airport, narrowly avoiding collision with the plane's nose wheel.

234.title: India win more medals in weightlifting at CWG 2022 than any other country
234.article_body: India clinched more medals in weightlifting at CWG 2022 than any other participating nation/territory. India ended their weightlifting campaign at CWG 2022 with a total of 10 medals, including three gold, three silver and four bronze medals. Canada bagged a total of eight weightlifting medals, while England won five medals.

235.title: China fires multiple missiles around Taiwan
235.article_body: China fired multiple missiles around Taiwan on Thursday as it launched its largest-ever military exercises a day after a visit by US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi. Taiwan's Defence Ministry said several Dongfeng missiles had been fired in waters to the northeast and southwest of the island. The last time China fired missiles into waters around Taiwan was in 1996.

236.title: Mumbai court extends ED custody of Sanjay Raut till August 8
236.article_body: A Mumbai court extended Enforcement Directorate (ED) custody of Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut till August 8. The MP, arrested in Patra Chawl money-laundering case, was produced before a special court today after his ED custody (as directed by PMLA court) ended. The court said that ED has made "remarkable progress" in the investigation and some aspects require further investigation.

237.title: We're stuck at place where we're trolled irrespective of body type: Kriti
237.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon has said that she does not pay attention to trolls who body-shame her. "We are still stuck at a place where we're trolled irrespective of the body type we have," she said. Kriti, however, added that people need to block out such trolls as they can't keep getting affected by strangers passing comments.

238.title: B'luru Police posts video of flooded roads, asks BBMP to repair urgently
238.article_body: Traffic police of Bengaluru's Pulakeshinagar shared a video of flooded roads in CV Raman Nagar due to water logging and asked BBMP to take quick action on it. Taking to Twitter, the traffic police wrote, "Hello sir, in BBMP Ward No-79...drainage is blocked...This often causes water logging and traffic problems. Therefore drainage repair work should be done urgently sir."

239.title: 5 people arrested in Hyderabad for conspiring to kill realtor
239.article_body: Hyderabad's Pahadishareef police on Tuesday arrested five people for allegedly conspiring to kill a realtor. According to police, a realtor, identified as Farhan, had property issues with the sister of main accused Hussain Awalgi, who then hatched a conspiracy with four others to kill him. Two knives, sickles and mobile phones were also recovered from the apprehended persons, police said.

240.title: Tiger Global sells over 18 crore shares of Zomato; cuts stake by almost half
240.article_body: Tiger Global's Singapore-based Internet Fund VI sold off nearly half of its shareholding in food delivery firm Zomato, the hedge fund company disclosed in a filing with stock exchanges. It stated that it effectively sold over 18 crore shares, with its shareholding in Zomato now reduced to 2.77%. Earlier, Uber reportedly sold its 7.8% stake in Zomato for $392 million.

241.title: Govt lists steps on correct way to fold the National Flag
241.article_body: Ahead of the Independence Day, the government has listed steps on the correct way to fold the National Flag. The flag should be placed horizontally, following which the saffron and green bands should be folded under the middle white band. After the process is complete, the flag should be carried in arms or palms to store it.

242.title: My 8 hrs are equal to 15 hrs of others: Akshay on 'lacks commitment' claims
242.article_body: Reacting to the claims that he lacked commitment in films, actor Akshay Kumar has said, "I spend only eight hours on a film set in a day...I don't spend a single minute...in a vanity van." He added, "My eight hours are equal to 14-15 hours of any other star." These claims emerged after the failure of his film 'Samrat Prithviraj'.

243.title: Mumbai Police seizes over 700 kg of banned drug worth ₹1,400 cr; 5 held
243.article_body: The Anti Narcotics Cell of Mumbai Police's crime branch seized over 700 kilograms of banned drug mephedrone worth ₹1,400 crore at a drug manufacturing unit in Palghar's Nalasopara. As many as five persons were arrested in connection with the case, an official said. This is one of the biggest drug hauls by Mumbai Police in recent times, the official added.

244.title: What are some of SC's key judgments which India's next Chief Justice UU Lalit was part of?
244.article_body: Justice UU Lalit was part of the ruling which held 'triple talaq' unconstitutional. A bench he headed reversed a Bombay HC judgment, ruling that physical contact with minors with sexual intent will be an offence even without "skin-to-skin" contact. Justice Lalit led a bench that ruled the erstwhile royal family of Travancore has the management right over Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple.

245.title: We are 'not struggling' against left-arm pacers: Rohit Sharma
245.article_body: Rohit Sharma said he doesn't believe facing left-arm pacers is a weakness for his team, following West Indies pacer Obed McCoy's six-wicket haul in the second T20I. "It happens when you're trying to score quickly," added Rohit. Ex-England captain Nasser Hussain earlier said India should play left-arm pacers better. "Shaheen Shah Afridi blew them away...in Dubai," he had stated.

246.title: Not afraid of PM Modi, will not be intimidated: Rahul on ED action
246.article_body: A day after ED sealed Congress-owned National Herald office, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said, "We'll not be intimidated." "We're not afraid of [PM] Narendra Modi…Will continue to work to protect the country, democracy and help maintain harmony…Will do my work whatever they may do," he added. "They can put up more barricades. Truth can't be barricaded," Gandhi stated.

247.title: Investigating US' claim of killing al-Qaeda chief: Taliban
247.article_body: The Taliban has said it is investigating US' claim that al-Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri was killed in a US drone strike in Kabul. Suhail Shaheen, the designated Taliban representative to the United Nations, added that results of the investigation would be shared publicly. Taliban leaders have not confirmed the presence or death of Zawahiri in Kabul.

248.title: Mumbai's bus conductor, out on bail, molests minor again
248.article_body: The Mumbai Police is searching for a 34-year-old man for allegedly molesting a 16-year-old girl, who is his neighbour, days after he came out on bail after being arrested for the same offence in June this year. The accused, who works as a bus conductor for BEST in Mumbai, has been booked under the POCSO Act for the second time.

249.title: UP govt employee seeks 3-day leave to 'resolve fight with wife'; letter goes viral
249.article_body: A leave application written by a government employee in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur is going viral after he sought for three days' leave to resolve fight with his wife. "There has been an argument with my wife regarding love," he stated in the letter, adding that she has gone to her mother's house with their elder daughter and her two children.

250.title: Arshdeep is a future world no. 1, will be picked for T20 WC: Srikkanth
250.article_body: Ex-Chairman of BCCI's selection committee Kris Srikkanth said Team India pacer Arshdeep Singh will be the world number one in T20Is in the future, adding he will be picked for the T20 World Cup 2022. "He is simply outstanding...Make a note of it," stated Srikkanth. Arshdeep is India's leading wicket-taker in the ongoing T20I series against West Indies.

251.title: No shortage of foodgrain in country: Union Agriculture Minister
251.article_body: Union Agriculture Minister Narendra Singh Tomar informed the Parliament that there is no shortage of foodgrain in the country and stocks are sufficient to meet the demand. There are adequate stocks in the “central pool”, he added. "As on July 1, 2022, the actual stock of wheat is 285.10 LMT against the buffer norm of 275.80 LMT," Tomar said.

252.title: Former Haryana Congress leader Kuldeep Bishnoi joins BJP
252.article_body: Former Haryana Congress leader Kuldeep Bishnoi joined the BJP on Thursday at the party headquarters in Delhi, a day after he resigned as MLA from Adampur. He was inducted into BJP in the presence of Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar. Bishnoi was expelled by Congress from all party positions for cross-voting in the Rajya Sabha polls on June 10.

253.title: Want to do a dysfunctional family drama with Arjun: Janhvi Kapoor
253.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor, on being asked about the type of film she would like to work on with brother Arjun Kapoor, said it should be a "dysfunctional family drama with humour". "I feel there should be a road trip...[It] should...be like we didn't know we were related and we bump into each other. Then we realise we're brother-sister," Janhvi added.

254.title: Berlin-based Zalando's operating profit falls 58% due to inflation
254.article_body: Zalando, a German online fashion retailer on Thursday, reported a 58% fall in operating profit for the second quarter as against the corresponding period last year. Zalando said that it is expecting to return to growth and improve profitability in the second half of the year. It attributed the fall to lower consumer confidence, inflation and supply bottlenecks hitting demand.

255.title: Mannat was 1st offered to me, dad said 'What'll you do in such big house': Salman
255.article_body: Actor Salman Khan, in a recent interview, has revealed that actor Shah Rukh Khan's Mumbai home Mannat was first offered to him at the start of his career. He added, "My dad (Salim Khan) said, 'What will you do in such a big house?'" Salman said he wants to ask SRK what does he do in such a "big house".

256.title: The Wadhwa Group presents 3 & 4 BHK villas at Passcode Greencard, Panvel
256.article_body: The Wadhwa Group offers 3 and 4 BHK Nature Villas at Passcode Greencard in Panvel starting from Rs. 1.99 Cr*. Each villa comes with its own garden, patio, exclusive clubhouse, and private parking amidst 16 acres of greenery with 15+ lifestyle amenities. According to the brand, the concept of nature villas comes from the location's serene surroundings and lush views.

257.title: 8,000 gelatin sticks found abandoned in Kerala’s Palakkad, probe on
257.article_body: Police in Kerala have launched an investigation after a large number of explosives were found abandoned near a quarry in Shornur, Palakkad district on Thursday. The seized explosives include 8,000 gelatin sticks stacked in 40 boxes. Police said they were informed about the explosives by locals and it's suspected that they were to be used for breaking rocks in quarries.

258.title: Is it suitable for ED to summon me amid ongoing session?: Kharge in RS
258.article_body: Addressing the Rajya Sabha, Congress MP Mallikarjun Kharge said, "Is it suitable for ED to summon me while the Parliament session is ongoing?" This was being done to demoralise the Opposition, he added. His statement comes after ED issued summons to Kharge asking him to be present at Herald House when it carries out searches as part of its probe.

259.title: Jaipur Police questions TV news anchor over misleading clips on Rahul Gandhi
259.article_body: Jaipur Police on Wednesday questioned TV news anchor Rohit Ranjan over misleading clips on Congress leader Rahul Gandhi that were aired on his show in July. Ranjan was sent a notice two days earlier to join the investigation in Jaipur. The show had linked Gandhi's remarks on vandalism at his office in Kerala's Wayanad to Udaipur's tailor murder case.

260.title: Don't react to negativity, it's only in words & air: Kartik Aaryan
260.article_body: During an interview, a fan asked Kartik Aaryan how it feels when people indirectly say something against him which can create a lot of misconceptions about him and how he wants his fans to react. To this, he replied, "I'd like to tell my fans to not react...Just don't ever react to negativity...it's only in words and...only in the air."

261.title: Pak don't have his replacement: Aaqib on Malik being dropped for Asia Cup
261.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Aaqib Javed said Pakistan don't have a replacement for Shoaib Malik who hasn't been picked in the nation's Asia Cup 2022 squad. "He perfectly fits at the number four spot," added Aaqib. Malik is the first-ever player from Asia to score 10,000 runs in T20 cricket. "Iftikhar Ahmad...has not made an impact while...Asif Ali is one-dimensional," stated Aaqib.

262.title: Hopefully by Budget session: Vaishnaw on data protection bill passage
262.article_body: After the government withdrew the Personal Data Protection Bill, 2019 from the Lok Sabha on Wednesday, Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said, "Hopefully by the Budget session we should be able to get the new law passed". The Bill was introduced on December 11, 2019 and was intended to provide for a law for the protection of personal data.

263.title: Vodafone Idea narrows Q1 loss to ₹7,296.7 crore, share price falls
263.article_body: Vodafone Idea Limited on Wednesday reported a marginal narrowing of its consolidated loss to ₹7,296.7 crore for the quarter ended June as against ₹7,319.1 crore in the year-ago period. The telco's share price fell over 4% to ₹8.71 apiece on the BSE on Thursday. The company also announced that Ravinder Takkar will take over as its Chairman on August 19.

264.title: Man arrested for raping 13-yr-old daughter after she delivers his baby in Tamil Nadu
264.article_body: A 41-year-old man in Tamil Nadu's Vellore has been arrested for allegedly raping and impregnating his 13-year-old daughter. Police said the Class VIII girl was admitted to a hospital where she delivered a baby boy and told the hospital authorities that her father had been sexually abusing her since last year. The accused and his wife separated eight years ago.

265.title: Very heavy to extremely heavy rainfall warning in several states; IMD releases list
265.article_body: The IMD has predicted isolated extremely heavy rainfall in ghat areas of Tamil Nadu and over coastal and south interior Karnataka between August 4 and 5. Meanwhile very heavy rainfall has been predicted in isolated areas of Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka, Kerala, Puducherry, Telangana, Chhattisgarh, Odisha, Goa and east Rajasthan between August 4 and 7.

266.title: 9 Indian-origin men on most violent gangster list of Canada Police; details released
266.article_body: Police in Canada have issued a public warning identifying 11 men, including nine of Indian origin, linked to extreme levels of gang violence. They are Shakiel Basra (28), Amarpreet Samra (28), Jagdeep Cheema (30), Ravinder Samra (35), Barinder Dhaliwal (39), Andy Pierre (40), Gurpreet Dhaliwal (35), Richard Joseph Whitlock (40), Samroop Gill (29), Sukhdeep Pansal (33) and Sumdish Gill (28).

267.title: Don't decide on Shinde camp's claim to be real Shiv Sena now: SC directs EC
267.article_body: The Supreme Court on Thursday directed Election Commission to not decide on Eknath Shinde camp's claim to be the real Shiv Sena as of now. The EC had fixed August 8 to hear claim of Eknath Shinde faction. EC can't decide who's real Sena until there's a decision on disqualification pleas, Kapil Sibal, appearing for Uddhav Thackeray faction, told court.

268.title: Berlin considers U-turn on nuclear power phaseout amid energy crisis
268.article_body: Germany has said that extending lifetime of country's remaining nuclear power plants might make sense. Germany switched off three out of six of its power plants in the end of 2021 and aimed to shut the remaining three at the end of 2022. However, the plan is under reconsideration after Russia reduced gas deliveries to Berlin for supporting Ukraine.

269.title: Suspected drones fly over Taiwan, Defence Ministry reports cyber attacks
269.article_body: After US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi concluded her Taiwan trip, unidentified aircraft, probably drones, flew above the area of Taiwan's outlying Kinmen islands near the mainland coast. Authorities also reported that hackers attacked the website of Defence Ministry. Meanwhile, China has launched its largest-ever military exercises around Taiwan.

270.title: Kerala HC seeks NTA's reply over standard exam protocol across India
270.article_body: Kerala High Court has sought a response from the National Testing Agency (NTA) to a plea seeking a standard protocol for conducting examinations across India. This comes after some girls were forced to remove bras at a NEET exam centre in Kerala's Kollam. The plea has also sought directions to NTA to permit the girls to re-appear for the exam.

271.title: People expect star kids to be perfectionists: Aishwaryaa Rajinikanth
271.article_body: Rajinikanth's daughter Aishwaryaa said the notion that celebrity kids have an easier time in the entertainment industry is a misconception. "It's difficult since we need to prove ourselves...without making any mistakes. People anticipate us to be perfectionists," Aishwaryaa added. She said that as compared to star kids, it's rather easy for newcomers to make errors and get away with them.

272.title: Have never given wife Twinkle chance to fear anything I do: Akshay Kumar
272.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar has said that he has never given his wife Twinkle Khanna a chance to fear anything he does. "My core belief has always been about catering to the family. Rarely have my films got an 'A' certificate from the censor board," he added. Akshay further stated he does "homely, family-oriented" films.

273.title: Joaquin Phoenix's 'Joker 2' set to release on October 4, 2024
273.article_body: A spokesperson of Warner Bros on Wednesday said Joaquin Phoenix-starrer 'Joker: Folie a Deux' will release on October 4, 2024. The film is a sequel to the 2019 film 'Joker'. Joaquin won the Academy Award for Best Actor for his role. Filmmaker Todd Phillips, who earned Academy Award nomination for Best Director for the 2019 film, will direct the sequel.

274.title: Think about Suryakumar, would you be happy opening?: Srikkanth to Kaif
274.article_body: Talking about batter Suryakumar Yadav opening in the T20Is against West Indies, ex-Chairman of BCCI's selection committee Kris Srikkanth asked former India batter Mohammad Kaif, "If I ask you to open...would you like it?" Kaif responded with a ''no''. "Same with Suryakumar. Think about him," stated Srikkanth. "Suryakumar...should be batting at number four...Don't spoil the cricketer," he said.

275.title: Attacks on Sikhs in Afghanistan is attack on identity of being Sikh: Harbhajan in RS
275.article_body: AAP Rajya Sabha MP Harbhajan Singh raised the issue of "attacks on Sikhs and gurdwaras in Afghanistan" on Wednesday in Rajya Sabha. "This is not only a matter which has hurt the sentiments of Sikhs living across the world...it is also an attack on the identity of being a Sikh," he added. "Why such attacks on us only?" he asked.

276.title: Campaign against Agnipath scheme from August 7: Rakesh Tikait
276.article_body: Speaking in Uttar Pradesh's Baghpat at a farmers' congregation, Bhartiya Kisan Union leader Rakesh Tikait said that his farmers' group will start a campaign against the Centre's Agnipath military recruitment scheme from August 7. "It will continue for over a week," he added. "The fight with the Centre and UP government over the issue was yet to begin," Tikait stated.

277.title: US House Speaker meets leaders in S Korea, discusses security, climate
277.article_body: After concluding her Taiwan trip, US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi headed to South Korea where she met top political leaders on Thursday. Pelosi met South Korean National Assembly Speaker Kim Jin-pyo and other leaders to discuss economic cooperation, regional security and climate change. Pelosi will reportedly visit an inter-Korean border area controlled by US-led UN Command and North Korea.

278.title: Russia accuses Azerbaijan of ceasefire violation in Karabakh conflict
278.article_body: Russia accused Azerbaijan of ceasefire violation in disputed region of Nagorno-Karabakh. On Wednesday, Azeri defence ministry accused Armenia of committing sabotage act. Meanwhile, Armenia called upon international community to help stop Azerbaijan's "aggressive actions". As tensions flared up in disputed region, three soldiers were killed. EU has called for "immediate cessation of hostilities".

279.title: CJI NV Ramana recommends Justice UU Lalit's name as his successor
279.article_body: Chief Justice of India NV Ramana has recommended Justice Uday Umesh Lalit's name as his successor. Justice Lalit will become the 49th CJI. Justice Lalit, who enrolled as an Advocate in June 1983, practised in the High Court of Bombay till December 1985 and was appointed Judge of the Supreme Court of India in August 2014.

280.title: Who won medals for India on Day 6 of CWG 2022?
280.article_body: India won five medals on Day 6 of CWG 2022, taking their medal tally to 18. Indian weightlifters Lovepreet Singh and Gurdeep Singh bagged bronze in men’s 109 kg and 109+ kg categories, respectively. Saurav Ghosal bagged bronze in men’s singles squash event, while judoka Tulika Maan clinched silver. Further, high jumper Tejaswin Shankar won India a bronze medal.

281.title: India beat Barbados by 100 runs, reach women's cricket semi-finals at CWG 2022
281.article_body: India defeated Barbados by 100 runs in their last group match of women's T20I cricket event at CWG 2022. With the victory, India advanced to the semi-finals of the tournament. India put up a total of 162/4 before restricting Barbados to 62/8 in their 20 overs. Renuka Singh registered figures of 4-0-10-4.

282.title: Tina Dabi shares Jaisalmer pics after Rajasthan gets highest rainfall in July in 66 years
282.article_body: IAS officer Tina Dabi shared photos of Rajasthan's Jaisalmer after the state received 270 mm of rainfall in July, the highest in 66 years. The Jaisalmer Collector wrote, "Who would believe this is a desert? Jaisalmer in monsoon!" She added, "This is how beautiful the various parts of the district are looking after receiving record-breaking rainfall in the last month."

283.title: 'Flood tourism' will not be permitted: Kerala minister amid rains
283.article_body: Amid rains in Kerala, state minister K Rajan on Wednesday said that people should strictly avoid going to areas which are inundated or flooded as part of a growing trend of “flood tourism”. He warned that such activities will not be permitted and police would be used to remove such persons.

284.title: CNG price increases by ₹6 per kg in Pune; 7th hike since April
284.article_body: The price of compressed natural gas (CNG) has been increased by ₹6 in Pune, effective from Thursday. CNG will now cost ₹91 per kg in Pune. This is the seventh price hike since April this year. "Overall, there is a shortage of CNG as there is no supply from Russia and Ukraine," All India Petroleum Dealers Association spokesperson said.

285.title: Delhi govt plans to introduce app-based premium bus service
285.article_body: Delhi government has revived its plan to introduce mobile application-based AC bus service to encourage office-goers to use public transport, officials said. Delhi government first approved this scheme in 2016 which got struck down by the then Lieutenant Governor for not taking his approval. It worked on the plan again in 2017-2018, but it fizzled out due to permit issues.

286.title: Manipur man arrested for murdering childhood friend in Hyderabad
286.article_body: Hyderabad police on Wednesday arrested a 21-year-old man from Manipur for allegedly killing his childhood friend. According to police, the accused, P Namasudra, and victim, Dipendu Biswas, were residents of Tukaramgate in Hyderabad. Biswas had reportedly developed intimacy with Namasudra's wife following which the latter decided to kill him. The incident took place on July 25, police added.

287.title: Russian man marries Ukrainian girlfriend in Dharamshala as per Indian traditions
287.article_body: Amid Russia-Ukraine war, a Russian man named Sergei Novikov recently married his Ukrainian girlfriend Elona Bramoka in Himachal Pradesh's Dharamshala as per Indian traditions. The couple could be seen in traditional Indian outfits during the wedding ceremony. "Our pandit Raman Sharma solemnised their marriage...as per the traditions of the Sanatan Dharma," Divya Ashram Kharota's official said.

288.title: How does the CWG 2022 medal tally read as India win 5 medals in a day?
288.article_body: India bagged five medals on Day 6 of CWG 2022, including one silver and four bronze medals. India are currently seventh on the medal standings with a total of five gold medals. Australia lead the standings with 46 gold medals. Meanwhile, England have become the second nation after Australia to bag more than 100 medals at CWG 2022.

289.title: He's impressed everyone with his calmness: PM Modi on Lovepreet's bronze
289.article_body: PM Narendra Modi took to Twitter to congratulate weightlifter Lovepreet Singh, who won a bronze medal at CWG 2022, breaking his own national record. "Lovepreet has impressed everyone with his calm temperament and dedication," he tweeted. PM Modi further termed him as "talented" and "dynamic" in his tweet. Lovepreet lifted a total of 355 kg in the men's 109-kg final.

290.title: Famous actor Mithilesh Chaturvedi passes away
290.article_body: Famous actor Mithilesh Chaturvedi has passed away. The actor reportedly breathed his last in Lucknow after suffering a cardiac ailment. The actor is known for being a part of multiple films and shows such as Gadar: Ek Prem Katha, Koi... Mil Gaya, My Friend Pinto, Phata Poster Nikla Hero and Ready amongst others.

291.title: 2 Sri Lankan athletes, 1 manager go missing at Commonwealth Games in UK
291.article_body: Three members of Sri Lanka's contingent at the Commonwealth Games in UK have disappeared. A judoka, a wrestler and the judo manager went missing. "We've asked all athletes and officials to submit their passports to our respective venue officials after the incident. The police is investigating and the three cannot cross the UK borders," said Sri Lankan team press attache.

292.title: It's 'very terrifying': Amitabh Bachchan on hosting seasons of KBC
292.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan, while talking about hosting 'Kaun Banega Crorepati' year after year, said he feels nervous every time he goes on the sets. "It's bhayankar (very terrifying). My hands and legs shake when I come on...set," Amitabh added. He further said that it's the audience that keeps him motivated, adding, "It's because of them that we are here."

293.title: She was very concerned: Tulika's mother on her considering leaving judo
293.article_body: Judoka Tulika Maan, who won a silver medal at CWG 2022, had contemplated quitting judo a few months back after not being named in the initial squad, terming the selection criteria "wrong" in an email. "It was...very difficult...She was very concerned about how things would pan out," said Tulika's mother Amrita Maan. "I couldn't show...I was upset," she added.

294.title: Quite bold of him: Aamir Khan on Ranveer Singh's nude photoshoot
294.article_body: During his appearance on 'Koffee With Karan 7', actor Aamir Khan reacted to actor Ranveer Singh's nude photoshoot. "He's got a great physique. I thought it was quite bold of him," Aamir said. This comes after Karan Johar had asked Kareena Kapoor which Instagram account will she visit to watch "thirsty photos". To this, Kareena named Ranveer Singh.

295.title: Suspended DCP Parag Manere reinstated by Maha CM Eknath Shinde-led govt
295.article_body: DCP Parag Manere, who was suspended by Uddhav Thackeray-led Maharashtra government, in an extortion case related to Param Bir Singh has been reinstated by Eknath Shinde-led government. Manere was suspended after the case was filed against Singh in which he was also an accused. Manere and others had allegedly demanded ₹2 crore from the complainant and forcibly acquired his land.

296.title: Was overconfident, thought people will come to see my 1st film: Janhvi on 'Dhadak'
296.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor said that she was "very unaware" during the release of her debut film 'Dhadak'. "It was the naiveness but there was also the overconfidence that 'people will definitely come to watch my first film to see how I am'," she added. The film, which also featured Ishaan Khatter, earned over ₹110 crore at the worldwide box office.

297.title: Elon Musk's answer to Twitter lawsuit to be made public by Friday
297.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's response to Twitter's lawsuit over his abandoned $44 billion buyout deal will be made public latest by Friday evening, a judge said. Musk's attorneys wanted to file the public version of their response on Wednesday, however, Twitter attorneys needed more time. "Few cases attract as much public interest as this one," the Twitter attorney wrote.

298.title: Happy that I could 'turn my coat': Supriyo on trolls calling him 'turncoat'
298.article_body: TMC's Babul Supriyo, who got inducted into Mamata Banerjee's cabinet on Wednesday, responded to trolls who called him a "turncoat" and said, "I am extremely happy I could show courage to 'Turn my Coat' on a party who unfairly tried to make me a 'Scape Goat'." "Half of your state governments are with 'poached' MLA's from other parties," he added.

299.title: Traffic to be hit on some routes of Mumbai due to VVIP visit
299.article_body: Traffic movement is expected to be slow on Eastern Freeway and Western Expressway on Thursday due to scheduled VVIP visit, the Mumbai Traffic Police said. The traffic will be slow from 9 am to 2 pm between NCPA to Vashi on Eastern Freeway and between 3 pm to 8 pm between NCPA to Dindoshi on Western Expressway, the police said.

300.title: Delhi reports India's 1st monkeypox case in a woman, city's count reaches 4
300.article_body: A Nigerian woman, living in Delhi for over a month, on Wednesday tested positive for monkeypox. This is the first confirmed monkeypox case in a woman in India. The number of confirmed monkeypox cases in Delhi has reached four and India's total tally has reached nine. Notably, the woman had no history of international travel in the last 21 days.

301.title: US Senate approves Sweden & Finland's bid to join NATO amid Ukraine war
301.article_body: US Senate has ratified the entry of Sweden and Finland into NATO amid Russia's war in Ukraine. Senate voted 95 to 1 in favour of the two countries' accession. "This historic vote sends an important signal of...sustained, bipartisan US commitment to NATO, and to ensuring our alliance is prepared to meet...challenges of today and tomorrow," US President Joe Biden said.

302.title: More special than gold: Anurag Thakur on Tejaswin's historic bronze
302.article_body: Reacting to Indian high jumper Tejaswin Shankar scripting history by becoming the first-ever Indian to win a medal in high jump at CWG, Sports Minister Anurag Thakur tweeted, "This bronze is more special than a gold!!" Tejaswin won a bronze medal with a best jump of 2.22 metres. He helped India win its first medal in athletics at CWG 2022.

303.title: 'Grotesque greed': UN chief criticises oil and gas companies
303.article_body: United Nations (UN) chief Antonio Guterres on Wednesday criticised the oil and gas companies for making record profits from the energy crisis "on the backs of the poorest people and communities and at a massive cost to the climate". Guterres further said that their "grotesque greed" was destroying "our only...home". He also urged all governments to tax these profits.

304.title: China begins its largest-ever military exercises around Taiwan
304.article_body: China has begun its largest-ever military exercises around Taiwan. This comes after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan despite China's warnings of consequences over it. Earlier, local news outlets reported that the Taiwanese Ministry of National Defense has begun to "immediately prepare for war" and has put the military on high alert.

305.title: My acting in 'A Thursday' left my house help terrified: Yami Gautam
305.article_body: Yami Gautam revealed that her house help was 'terrified' after watching her performance in 'A Thursday'. The woman reportedly told the actress that she broke a glass and hoped that she wouldn't treat her like the film. Yami added that she took it as a compliment and was happy that she managed to create such an impact through her performance.

306.title: India to have US-like roads by 2024: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari
306.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said government will construct 26 green express highways by 2024 and bring down travel time between key cities across India. "By 2024, I guarantee...roads in India will be like those in US," he added. Furthermore, he said, once highways are completed, travel time from Delhi to Dehradun, Haridwar and Jaipur will be reduced to two hours.

307.title: Winter COVID wave may have peaked early: Australian Health Minister
307.article_body: Australian Health Minister Mark Butler said on Thursday that the country may have reached the peak of the latest wave of COVID-19 outbreak earlier than expected. Australia witnessed winter outbreak due to the new Omicron sub-variant BA.4/5, putting strain on hospitals and retirement homes. However, hospitals have reported a steady fall in number of admissions over the past week.

308.title: Sensex jumps 334.22 points, Nifty above 17,479 in opening trade
308.article_body: Benchmark indices opened on a positive note on Thursday with Sensex and Nifty surging 334.22 points and 91.60 points, respectively. The Sensex opened at 58,684.75 points and Nifty at 17,479.80. Hindalco Industries, Infosys, UltraTech Cement and IndusInd Bank were among the major Nifty gainers, while Tata Consumer Products, Britannia Industries, SBI Life Insurance, ONGC and Divis Labs slipped.

309.title: 7-yr-old boy makes Zomato deliveries on cycle till 11pm after father's accident
309.article_body: A Twitter user shared a video, showing a seven-year-old boy delivering orders for Zomato after his father, a Zomato delivery agent, met with an accident. The boy said that he goes to school in the morning and delivers orders from 6-11pm on a cycle. "Kindly share his father's details with us via a private message," Zomato replied on the post.

310.title: A year ago, I realised I didn't spend much time with Ira & Junaid: Aamir
310.article_body: Aamir Khan, on the show 'Koffee With Karan 7', said he went through "a lot of introspection" last year. "I felt I didn't nurture my relationships like my work. I realised...I've not spent so much time with Ira...Junaid since they were children," he stated. Aamir added he's a changed person now and connects more with his family and his children.

311.title: India reports 19,893 new COVID-19 cases, list of states with most active cases released
311.article_body: India has reported 19,893 COVID-19 cases and 53 deaths in the last 24 hours including 15 reconciled deaths in Kerala. India's active COVID-19 cases stood at 1,36,478, while the death toll reached 5,26,530. Kerala has the maximum active cases in the country at 12,715, followed by Maharashtra with 12,321 active cases and Tamil Nadu with 11,392 active cases.

312.title: Gurugram man posed as pilot on Instagram, cheated over 30 women
312.article_body: Gurugram Police arrested a man from Sector 43 area for allegedly duping over 30 women after befriending them on Instagram by posing as a pilot, officials said. The matter came to light after a woman filed a complaint that accused Hemant Sharma fraudulently transferred over ₹1 lakh from her account. He especially used to befriend airline crew members, police said.

313.title: ASEAN warns of open conflicts due to volatility over Taiwan
313.article_body: The Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) issued a warning on Thursday that an increased international and regional volatility could result in "miscalculation, serious confrontation, open conflicts and unpredictable consequences" among powers. The statement came from foreign ministers when the Southeast Asian regional bloc's chair Cambodia called on all parties to de-escalate on Taiwan.

314.title: Party 'under siege': Cong after police deployed outside party headquarters
314.article_body: After ED sealed the Congress-owned National Herald office and police were deployed outside Congress headquarters, party's General Secretary Jairam Ramesh on Wednesday said Congress is "under siege". Another Congress leader Abhishek Manu Singhvi said, "You're treating this institution, this party, these leaders as terrorists. It's the worst form of petty politics and on the contrary, you blame us."

315.title: Chrissy Teigen announces pregnancy 2 years after miscarriage; shares pics
315.article_body: Chrissy Teigen and her husband John Legend are expecting another child nearly two years after the couple suffered a pregnancy loss. Teigen made the announcement on Wednesday while sharing two photos of her baby bump on Instagram. "We have another on the way," wrote the 36-year-old model, who shares two children — Luna and Miles — with Legend.

316.title: Bengaluru records highest rainfall in August in last 5 yrs: IMD
316.article_body: Bengaluru recorded 63.3 mm of rainfall till Wednesday, which is the highest in last five years in the month of August, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said. The previous highest rainfall for August was recorded at 128.7 mm in 2017. Several areas in Bengaluru including Horamavu, Sarjapur, Bellandur and Nandini Layout reported waterlogging following heavy rainfall on Monday and Tuesday.

317.title: 2 workers dead, 1 injured after gas leakage at factory in WB's North 24 Parganas
317.article_body: At least two workers died and one was hospitalised in a gas leak incident at an electro steel factory on Wednesday in North 24 Parganas' Khardah in West Bengal, police said. Carbon monoxide gas leaked from the factory, as per initial reports. The injured person was hospitalised and is in critical condition, police added. A case has been registered.

318.title: Mangroves along Palm Beach Road in Mumbai destroyed, claim environmentalists
318.article_body: More than 10 hectares of mangroves along Palm Beach Road in Navi Mumbai is in need of preservation as there are repeated instances to destroy these natural habitats, claimed the city environmentalists. A PIL is filed in court highlighting the matter which states that the mangroves along 4 km are destroyed as the area is not transferred to Forest Department.

319.title: Amrita Singh visited me at K3G trials, said 'Sara wants a picture with you': Kareena
319.article_body: Kareena Kapoor revealed her husband and actor Saif Ali Khan's ex-wife Amrita Singh had visited her while she was at the trials of 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham'. "I remember at the K3G trials, Sara Ali Khan was hiding behind her mother," she stated. "Amrita was...like 'Sara...wants a picture because she's...a big fan. She had loved Poo in K3G'," Kareena added.

320.title: Police bust fake firm offering loans of up to ₹100 cr in Pune, 3 held
320.article_body: Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad Police busted a fake firm offering loans of up to ₹100 crore and cheating several persons in Maharashtra, and arrested three persons in connection with the case. This comes after a man, a Kothrud resident, claimed he was offered a loan of ₹1 crore within 45 days of payment of a security deposit of ₹5 lakh in cash.

321.title: ₹85 lakh cash found at MP clerk's home during search, he drinks bathroom cleaner
321.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Police's Economic Offences Wing recovered over ₹85 lakh cash from the home of a government clerk attached to the state Medical Education Department in Bhopal. The clerk, Hero Keswani, reportedly consumed bathroom cleaner when the EOW team reached his house and was rushed to a hospital. Documents pertaining to several properties worth crores of rupees were also found.

322.title: 1,200-yr-old Hindu temple in Pakistan to be restored after eviction of illegal occupants
322.article_body: A 1,200-year-old Hindu temple in Pakistan's Lahore will be restored after illegal occupants were evicted from it following a lengthy court battle, a federal body said. The Evacuee Trust Property Board (ETPB) last month retrieved the possession of the Valmiki Mandir. The property was possessed by a Christian family, which claims to have converted to Hinduism.

323.title: Bengaluru reports 1,584 fresh cases of COVID-19, 1 death
323.article_body: Bengaluru reported 1,584 fresh cases of COVID-19 on Wednesday, according to data shared by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) chief Tushar Giri Nath. The city also reported one death due to COVID-19 on Wednesday. Moreover, with 8,464 active cases, the test positivity rate in the city for the last seven days now stands at 7.94%, BBMP data showed.

324.title: BJP wants to put money into pockets of big businessmen: Rahul Gandhi
324.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said BJP wants that nothing in India should be made by small and medium businesses. "They want everything made by two to three of their favourite big businessmen. Their entire idea is to take money out of people's pockets and put it into big businessmen's pockets," he added while addressing the media in Karnataka.

325.title: Don't fly kites near electric cables: BSES advisory for Independence Day
325.article_body: Ahead of Independence Day, BSES, a company which supplies power in Delhi, issued an advisory, asking people not to fly kites near electrical installations or cables as it could pose risk to life. The BSES also asked people to avoid using metal or metal-coated manjha. These two simple mantras will ensure safe Independence Day celebrations, a BSES official said.

326.title: DDA can't evict encroachers with bulldozer at doorstep without notice: HC
326.article_body: Delhi Development Authority (DDA) cannot evict encroachers with a bulldozer at their doorstep early morning or late evening without any notice, Delhi High Court said. "DDA has to act in consultation with Delhi Urban Shelter Improvement Board before embarking upon any such venture," it added. "A reasonable period has to be given...temporary location has to be provided," HC ruled.

327.title: Was never offered the film: Kareena on reports of demanding ₹12 cr to play Sita
327.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan has refuted the reports that had claimed she demanded ₹12 crore to play the role of Sita in the epic 'Ramayana'. "I was never offered that film so I don't know why I was put into that category," she stated. The actress called these "made-up stories" and added she doesn't know where the reports emerged from.

328.title: UK Parliament closes its TikTok account over China concerns
328.article_body: The UK Parliament has closed down its TikTok account after MPs raised concerns about the risk of data being passed to the Chinese government. "The account was a pilot initiative while we tested the platform as a way of reaching younger audiences with relevant content about Parliament," a spokesperson said. TikTok is owned by Chinese company ByteDance.

329.title: 7 dead people receive wages under MGNREGA for a year; 9 booked in Nuh
329.article_body: Haryana's Nuh Police have booked nine people for allegedly issuing job cards under the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA). The cards were fraudulently issued to 87 people, including seven men who died between 2011 and 2017. Their bank accounts received wages under MGNREGA for one year, causing a loss of ₹21 lakh to state exchequer, police said.

330.title: Tejaswin Shankar wins bronze, India's first medal in high jump in CWG history
330.article_body: Indian high jumper Tejaswin Shankar created history by becoming the first-ever Indian to win a medal in high jump in the history of Commonwealth Games (CWG). The 23-year-old bagged bronze medal with a best jump of 2.22 metres in men's high jump at CWG 2022. It is India's first athletics medal at the ongoing Games.

331.title: Mumbai chana vendor cheated by frauds posing as army officers
331.article_body: A 45-year-old vendor who sells chana outside the Breach Candy Hospital at Cumballa Hill was cheated of ₹16,400 by frauds posing as army officers. The accused called the victim pretending to be an officer of the Indian Army and ordered chana. However, he took money from the vendor in the guise of getting him a refund but escaped with ₹16,400.

332.title: 8-yr-old dies of suspected pesticide poisoning in B'luru
332.article_body: An eight-year-old girl died of suspected pesticide poisoning in Bengaluru's Vasanth Nagar on Tuesday, while her parents are still being treated at a private hospital. They had been advised to stay away from their rented accommodation till the clean-up for pest control was over. The family returned early and inhaled toxic fumes and drank coffee made of contaminated water.

333.title: Gurdeep Singh lifts 390 kg to win bronze, India's 10th weightlifting medal at CWG 2022
333.article_body: India's 26-year-old weightlifter Gurdeep Singh bagged a bronze medal in the men's 109+ kg final after lifting a total of 390 kg. He lifted 167 kg in the snatch event and 223 kg in the clean and jerk event. India have now won 10 medals in weightlifting at CWG 2022, including four bronze, three silver and three gold medals.

334.title: Such issues shouldn't be politicised: RSS responds to critics
334.article_body: The Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) has responded to critics over why their social media does not have a tricolour photo as their profile picture, saying that such things should not be politicised. RSS Akhil Bharatiya Prachar Pramukh Sunil Ambekar said that the RSS has already extended its support to 'Har Ghar Tiranga' and 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav' programmes.

335.title: 23-year-old Tulika Maan wins silver medal at CWG 2022, takes India's tally to 16 medals
335.article_body: Judoka Tulika Maan on Wednesday bagged a silver medal in judo at CWG 2022, taking India's medal tally at the Games to 16. The 23-year-old lost to Sarah Adlington of Scotland in the women's +78 kg category final. India have won three medals in judo at CWG 2022 so far, including one bronze and two silver medals.

336.title: Congress united to defeat BJP in Karnataka: Rahul Gandhi
336.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that the party was united to defeat BJP in the Karnataka state assembly elections after the state party chief DK Shivakumar hugged Siddaramaiah in a public show of unity. Both the leaders are in the front-running for the Chief Minister's post if Congress wins the elections. Gandhi praised the tremendous work done by Shivakumar.

337.title: We are not afraid: Congress after ED seals National Herald office
337.article_body: After ED sealed Congress-owned National Herald office and police were deployed outside Congress headquarters, the party's General Secretary Jairam Ramesh said, "This is politics of vengeance [and] intimidation." "Those who...spread the atmosphere of fear are afraid. We are not afraid," he added. He added that Delhi Police are trying to suppress Congress from holding a protest against inflation.

338.title: Sri Lankan Prez proposes 25-year roadmap for crisis-hit nation
338.article_body: Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe on Wednesday said his government is preparing a 25-year national policy to reduce public debt and make the nation competitive in the export market. Sri Lanka is experiencing one of its worst economic crises, with it suspending repayment of foreign loans in April this year. In total, Sri Lanka owes $51 billion in foreign debt.

339.title: 17 killed, 4 wounded as microbus hits truck in south Egypt
339.article_body: At least 17 people were killed and four people were injured when a microbus hit a truck in southern Egypt's Sohag province, 390 km from capital Cairo, officials said on Wednesday. Deadly accidents take thousands of lives in Egypt each year. The accidents happen mostly because of overspeeding, poor roads or lack of traffic law enforcement.

340.title: Hyderabad-based finance operations startup Bluecopa raises $2.3 mn
340.article_body: Finance operations startup, Bluecopa, raised $2.3 million in a seed funding round. The round was led by Blume Ventures and saw participation from Titan Capital, T-Fund, Speciale Invest, Bharat Founders Fund, T2D3, Amplify and Force Ventures. The Hyderabad-based firm, founded by Raghavendra Reddy, Satyaprakash Buddhavarapu and Nilotpal Chanda, helps companies get a real-time view of their business.

341.title: Retired B'luru CCB inspector gets 4-yr jail in illegal assets case
341.article_body: A former police inspector from the Bengaluru City Crime Branch (CCB), Sami-ur-Rahman, was sentenced to four years of rigorous imprisonment by a special court in a disproportionate assets case. He was raided in March 2006 and was found to have disproportionate assets worth ₹79.79 lakh. The court imposed a fine of ₹50 lakh on Rahman and ₹50,000 on his wife.

342.title: Meta exploring its first-ever sale of corporate bonds: Reports
342.article_body: Meta Platforms has reportedly asked banks to look into demand for a potential corporate bond sale, what would be the firm's first bond sale. The company has reportedly asked Morgan Stanley, JPMorgan Chase, Bank of America and Barclays to arrange calls with potential investors. Meta is one of 18 companies among S&P 500 that has no long-term or short-term debt.

343.title: Congress calls meeting of MPs to discuss future strategy of party
343.article_body: Congress has called a meeting of its Rajya Sabha and Lok Sabha MPs at Congress Parliamentary Party office on Thursday to discuss the future strategy of the party. This comes after Enforcement Directorate sealed Congress-owned National Herald office. Moreover, police officers were deployed outside Congress headquarters and Sonia Gandhi's residence to prevent any potential protest against ED's move.

344.title: Partha not cooperating, Arpita comparatively forthcoming: ED to court
344.article_body: Additional Solicitor General of India SV Raju claimed before the court that Partha Chatterjee has not been cooperating in the investigation, while Arpita Mukherjee has been comparatively cooperative. ED sought four days' custody of former Education Minister Partha Chatterjee in the SSC scam case before a special court in Kolkata on Wednesday.

345.title: Gujarat's Surat reports 1st death from swine flu this year
345.article_body: Surat in Gujarat reported its first death due to swine flu this year. The victim has been identified as a 49-year-old woman, from the Nana Varachha area, who was admitted to a private hospital a few days ago. So far this year, 32 swine flu patients have been hospitalised in the city, Surat Municipal Corporation's Health Department said.

346.title: 15-yr-old footballer raped by 2 teenage boys in Ranchi, accused held
346.article_body: Police on Wednesday said that a 15-year-old footballer was allegedly raped by two teenage boys in Jharkhand's Ranchi. The incident took place when the girl was returning home after playing a football match in Odisha on Monday, the police added. She registered a complaint on Tuesday, following which the two boys, around 17 years old, were arrested, police said.

347.title: Saurav Ghosal becomes 1st Indian squash player to win a CWG singles medal, bags bronze
347.article_body: Saurav Ghosal on Wednesday created history by becoming the first-ever Indian to win a singles medal in squash in the history of CWG. The 35-year-old defeated England's James Willstrop to finish third in the men's singles event at CWG 2022. Notably, Ghosal had won silver medal in mixed doubles event at CWG 2018 in Gold Coast.

348.title: Kolkata school to build its own nano-satellite
348.article_body: A Kolkata-based private school will build its own nano-satellite to educate its students in space technology. South Point High School has named the satellite 'PriyamvadaSat' and signed an agreement with Indian Technology Congress Association for its design, development, testing, integration and launch. ISRO will send the satellite into Low Earth Orbit from Sriharikota.

349.title: US, Indonesia conduct military drills amid Chinese threat
