349.article_body: The US and Indonesia began their annual joint military exercises on Wednesday amid growing maritime concerns posed by China in the Indo-Pacific. For the first time, soldiers from Australia, Japan and Singapore joined the combat drills. "It's a symbol of the US-Indonesia bond and the growing relationship between land forces in this consequential region," the US said in a statement.

350.title: 2 killed, 2 injured in a bus-car collision in Rajasthan's Barmer
350.article_body: At least two people were killed and two others were injured after a bus collided with a car in Rajasthan's Barmer on Wednesday, police said. The deceased were identified as 44-year-old Jeer Bhai, the car driver, and 42-year-old Varsha. The occupants of the car hailed from Gujarat and were on their way to visit Ramdevra, the SHO said.

351.title: 25-year-old man falls off Mumbai local train; dies
351.article_body: A 25-year-old man died after falling off a fast local train between Dombivli and Diva stations in Mumbai on Wednesday, the Government Railway Police (GRP) said. As per the preliminary investigation, the man who was travelling on the CSTM-bound suburban train was probably standing on its footboard when his head hit a pole along the railway track, and he fell.

352.title: Kerala man going from Kanyakumari to Kashmir on skateboard dies in Haryana
352.article_body: Anas Hajas, a 31-year-old resident of Kerala who was travelling from Kanyakumari to Kashmir on a skateboard, lost his life after a speeding truck hit him in Haryana's Panchkula on Tuesday. Hajas had started his 3,511-km-long journey on May 29 to create awareness among people about skating. After completing this trip, he was planning trips to Nepal, Bhutan and Cambodia.

353.title: 18 TRS MLAs, 5 Congress MLAs to join BJP: Telangana BJP leader
353.article_body: Telangana BJP leader Natcharaju Venkata Subhash claimed Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) has decided that around 15-18 of its MLAs will join BJP. "TRS MLAs are unable to go to their...constituencies because of the false promises [made by CM Chandrashekar Rao]," he added. Further, he said five Congress MLAs have consented to join BJP. This comes ahead of Telangana Assembly elections.

354.title: India announce playing XI for their must-win match against Barbados at CWG 2022
354.article_body: Barbados captain Hayley Matthews won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in their last women's T20I cricket group match at CWG 2022. The winner of the match between India and Barbados will advance to the semi-finals along with Australia from Group A. India have included Taniyaa Bhatia and Pooja Vastrakar in their playing XI.

355.title: Traveller fined ₹1.4 lakh after food found in luggage at Aus airport
355.article_body: A traveller was fined AUD 2,664 (₹1.4 lakh) by airport authorities in Australia's Darwin after undeclared food was detected in their luggage by a security dog. The person, who had arrived from Indonesia's Bali, was reportedly carrying sandwiches from McDonald's. The traveller was fined under Australia's new biosecurity rules after a Foot and Mouth disease outbreak was reported in Indonesia.

356.title: Srinagar received record rainfall this June and July: Report
356.article_body: Srinagar received the highest rainfall in 122 years for the months of June and July in this year, according to a private weather report on Wednesday. The observatory at Ram Munshi Bagh in the Valley recorded total rainfall of 230.0 mm for the two months, which is 107% above average. The average rain for this period is 110.9 mm.

357.title: UP Police arrest 11 for stealing copper wires from railway dept
357.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Police arrested 11 people who allegedly stole copper wires from the Mirzapur district's railway department. Police raided a semi-constructed house and arrested 10 people and recovered 107 kg copper wires, ₹50,740, five illegal guns and an SUV, among other things. The police said that the accused persons were stealing and selling the copper wires.

358.title: Delhi sees over 2,000 new COVID-19 cases & 5 deaths; positivity rate at 11.64%
358.article_body: Delhi reported 2,073 new COVID-19 cases and five deaths on Wednesday, while the positivity rate stood at 11.64%. This is the highest single-day rise in cases in over a month and third day in a row that the positivity rate has crossed the 10% mark. On Tuesday, Delhi saw 1,506 fresh COVID-19 cases and the positivity rate stood at 10.63%.

359.title: New Moonlighting policy allows Swiggy employees to take second job
359.article_body: Food delivery platform Swiggy announced an industry-first Moonlighting policy which allows employees to work on other projects after work hours for pro-bono or economic consideration, based on internal approvals. A company release said that this was another step to building a "world-class 'people-first' organisation". The policy allows employees to work second jobs, under certain conditions.

360.title: BharatPe appoints ex-head of SBI Card Nalin Negi as CFO
360.article_body: Fintech unicorn BharatPe has appointed the former head of SBI Card, Nalin Negi, as its Chief Financial Officer as the company prepares for its Initial Public Offering (IPO). In a statement, BharatPe said that Negi will be working towards making the company EBITDA positive by March 2023. Negi will be reporting to Suhail Sameer, the company's Chief Executive Officer (CEO).

361.title: Assam to remit sentences of 18 prisoners by Independence Day
361.article_body: To commemorate the 75th year of independence, Assam government has decided to remit the sentences of 18 prisoners under certain categories, as per a notification. The 18 prisoners will be released by Independence Day. All state governments were directed by the Ministry of Home Affairs to give special remission to certain categories of prisoners and release them.

362.title: Plea seeking 'jalabhishek' of Lord Krishna at Mathura mosque rejected
362.article_body: A district court in Mathura, Uttar Pradesh, on Wednesday rejected a revised application seeking permission to perform the 'jalabhishek' of Lord Krishna on the premises of Shahi Idgah Masjid. The petition had been filed by Dinesh Sharma, national treasurer of Akhil Bharat Hindu Mahasabha. He claimed the birthplace of Lord Krishna exists inside the premises of the mosque in Mathura.

363.title: ICC releases all-time T20I batting rankings as Suryakumar enters top 20
363.article_body: The ICC has shared the latest all-time T20I batting rankings, with India's Suryakumar Yadav entering the top 20. Suryakumar is ranked 17th with 816 rating points. Virat Kohli (897 rating points) and KL Rahul (854) are the other two Indians to feature in the top 20. The all-time rankings are led by Dawid Malan, with 915 rating points.

364.title: 15 men enter woman's house and kidnap her in Tamil Nadu, CCTV footage surfaces
364.article_body: A woman was kidnapped by her stalker and 14 of his associates at her house in Tamil Nadu's Mayiladuthurai on Tuesday. Based on a tipoff, the police immediately formed a special team, zeroed down on the accused and rescued the woman. Reports suggested that the woman was kidnapped after she refused to accept the proposal of the prime accused.

365.title: Clerk consumes floor cleaner during raid at his house in Bhopal
365.article_body: An Upper Divisional Clerk (UDC) working with Madhya Pradesh's Medical Education Department reportedly consumed floor cleaner during an Economic Offence Wing (EOW) raid at his house in Bhopal on Wednesday. The EOW had reached his home to conduct searches in connection to a complaint of disproportionate assets. The 54-year-old was rushed to a hospital and is said to be stable.

366.title: Sri Lanka SC extends foreign travel ban on ex-PM Mahinda till Aug 11
366.article_body: Sri Lankan Supreme Court on Wednesday extended the overseas travel ban on ex-PM Mahinda Rajapaksa and ex-Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa till August 11 amid the country's economic crisis. Notably, ex-President Gotabaya Rajapaksa, who is currently in Singapore, will now be able to stay there till August 11 as he was reportedly granted a 14-day extension on his short-term visa pass.

367.title: Once cycled 100 km to get firm listed on London Stock Exchange: Vedanta chief
367.article_body: Vedanta Resources Chairman Anil Agarwal said he once had to cycle 100 km to get his company listed on London Stock Exchange. Agarwal said then JP Morgan Vice Chairman Ian Hannam had invited him to cycle to Oxford to challenge him, which was about 100 km away. "I immediately said yes...After a few hours, I could barely continue," he added.

368.title: Respond to attacks but maintain decency: Uddhav to Sena spokespersons
368.article_body: Shiv Sena spokesperson Arvind Sawant said party chief Uddhav Thackeray met with Shiv Sena spokespersons on Wednesday to discuss the crisis within the party. Sawant said Thackeray asked the spokespersons to respond to attacks but maintain decency of language. Another party spokesperson Sachin Ahir said Thackeray guided them on effective ways to accomplish the tasks they were assigned.

369.title: MP villagers beat up Maha men on cattle smuggling suspicion; 1 dead, 2 injured
369.article_body: Villagers in Madhya Pradesh's Narmadapuram allegedly beat up three men from Maharashtra's Amravati on suspicion of cattle smuggling, police said. While one man died, two others were injured after the villagers stopped their truck carrying 28 cattle. "We're trying to figure out if they just provided the truck or were...[taking] the bovines for their own business," said SP Gurkaran Singh.

370.title: Delhi Police stopped us from conducting raid in J'khand MLAs case: CID
370.article_body: West Bengal CID alleged that police officers acting on the direction of South West Delhi's DCP stopped its team from conducting a raid in Chanakyapuri in connection with the Jharkhand MLAs cash seizure case. "We weren't allowed to search [businessman Sidharth Majumdar's residence] because the investigating officer...in whose name the [search warrant was] issued wasn't present," a CID officer said.

371.title: TV actor Parul Gulati cheated of ₹2.2 lakh by assistant in Mumbai
371.article_body: TV and Punjabi film actor Parul Gulati, who owns a hair wig manufacturing company, was reportedly cheated of ₹2.2 lakh over the past month by her assistant in Mumbai. Parul alleged that the accused, Komal Parmar, contacted her clients, who used to visit her office for wig trials, without her knowledge and sold them the products at cheaper rates.

372.title: UP govt will provide at least 1 job per family: CM Yogi Adityanath
372.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath said on Wednesday that the state government will provide at least one job to every family in an effort to boost employment. He stated that a skill mapping exercise to gather data on families where no member is employed will be initiated soon. "As per requirement, people will be trained and associated with employment," he added.

373.title: Jawan martyred after boulder falls on him in Uttarakhand
373.article_body: An Army jawan was martyred and another was injured after a boulder fell on them in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district near the China border. Soldier Sukhjinder Singh fell into a deep gorge from the impact of the boulder where he died. The jawans were posted at the Army unit in Harshil valley and were walking from Nelang when the incident occurred.

374.title: Indo-Canadian politician rescues man from bull at event, gets praise
374.article_body: An Indo-Canadian politician from Alberta has garnered praise for tackling a bull and rescuing a man from being trampled by the animal at a rodeo event in Calgary. Leela Aheer had jumped over the barrier to push the animal away from the man on the ground. Aheer, who is also Alberta's MLA, said that she acted upon her maternal instincts.

375.title: 42 inmates test positive for COVID-19 in Haridwar jail
375.article_body: At least 42 prisoners in Uttarakhand's Haridwar jail have tested positive for COVID-19, officials said on Wednesday. "On World Hepatitis Day along with Hepatitis B, RT-PCR test of prisoners was conducted during a medical camp," Superintendent of Haridwar prison Manoj Kumar Arya said. All prisoners who tested positive are asymptomatic, Manoj Kumar Arya added.

376.title: Seminary teacher arrested for raping 10 minor students in Pakistan
376.article_body: A seminary teacher was arrested in Pakistan's Punjab province on Wednesday for allegedly raping 10 minor male students, officials said. Qari Bashir confessed to committing the crimes in the last two months in Sadiqabad Rahim Yar Khan and was now in police custody, officials said. Five of the survivors were sent to hospital for medical examination.

377.title: CM Mamata is kingpin, she should quit: Suvendu Adhikari on SSC scam
377.article_body: Leading a protest against SSC scam in Kolkata, West Bengal BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari said Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee is the kingpin in the scam and demanded her resignation. "It is the party's money, CM Banerjee's money. Partha Chatterjee was only a custodian," Adhikari said. "Her (Mamata Banerjee's) whole racket should be taken into custody," he added.

378.title: 4,690 arrested under UAPA from 2018-2020, only 149 convicted: Govt
378.article_body: Union Minister of State for Home Nityanand Rai on Wednesday said 4,690 people were arrested under Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) between 2018 and 2020, but only 149 were convicted in three years. The highest number of people arrested under UAPA between 2018 and 2020 was in Uttar Pradesh, which was 1,338, Rai said, adding 943 were arrested in Manipur.

379.title: 38-yr-old woman smothered to death by in-laws in J&K's Bemina, 5 held
379.article_body: A 38-year-old woman, Tasleema Bani, was allegedly smothered to death by her in-laws in Jammu and Kashmir's Bemina area, after which five members of the family were arrested, a police spokesperson said on Wednesday. The woman was taken to a hospital, where she was declared dead. The postmortem report stated that asphyxiation was the cause of the woman's death.

380.title: India announce schedule for their home series against Australia and South Africa
380.article_body: The BCCI on Wednesday announced the schedule for India's upcoming series against Australia and South Africa at home. India will play three T20Is against Australia from September 20 to 25. India-South Africa T20I series will begin on September 28 and end on October 4. The T20I series will be followed by a three-match ODI series from October 6 to 11.

381.title: India thrash Canada 8-0 in men's hockey, jump to top of their group at CWG 2022
381.article_body: India defeated Canada 8-0 in their second-last Pool B match in men's hockey at CWG 2022. With the win, India jumped to the top of Pool B with 7 points and a goal difference of 19. Harmanpreet Singh and Akashdeep Singh scored two goals each against Canada. India will next face Wales on Thursday.

382.title: Traffic diversions in Hyderabad over inauguration of new police HQ
382.article_body: Hyderabad Police announced a series of traffic diversions as the Telangana Chief Minister will be inaugurating the Technology Fusion Centre on August 4. The new police headquarters is located in Banjara Hills and the Hyderabad Traffic Police asked motorists to avoid Road No 12 between 11 am and 5 pm. Over ₹600 crore was spent on building the centre.

383.title: Indigo narrows Q1 net loss to ₹1,064 crore, revenue up 328%
383.article_body: Indigo's parent company, Interglobe Aviation said that its net loss narrowed to ₹1,064.3 crore for the quarter ended June as against ₹3,174.2 crore in the year-ago period. Its revenue from operations rose 328%. “Our revenue performance this quarter was impressive...However, cost pressures on fuel and foreign exchange prevented us from translating...into net profitability," CEO Ronojoy Dutta said.

384.title: 4 dead, 2 critical after gas leakage at a factory in Haryana
384.article_body: At least four people died and two were injured after gas leakage at a factory in Haryana's Bahadurgarh industrial area on Wednesday. The injured persons were admitted to the intensive care unit (ICU) at a hospital. "Labourers had gone down a five-foot-deep tank to clean it," a senior officer said.

385.title: Ex-German Chancellor meets Putin, discusses Ukraine war
385.article_body: Germany's former Chancellor Gerhard Schröder has met Russian President Vladimir Putin, and discussed the Russia-Ukraine war. Schröder said last month's deal to provide a safe route in the Black Sea to move Ukrainian grain stocks could be the first step towards a ceasefire in the Russia-Ukraine war. However, neither of the countries have indicated this as attacks have continued.

386.title: Water vapour sent into stratosphere by Tonga eruption could heat up Earth
386.article_body: The underwater eruption of Hunga Tonga-Hunga Ha'apai volcano in January released a record amount of water into the Earth's atmosphere, NASA scientists said. The eruption expelled 146 teragrams of water vapour into the stratosphere that's nearly 10% of the water already present there. This amount is enough to have a small, temporary warming effect on Earth's average temperature, they added.

387.title: Rainwater everywhere on Earth contains cancer-causing chemicals: Study
387.article_body: Rainwater, even in the remotest part of the Earth, contains cancer-causing forever chemicals making it unsafe to drink, a study has found. Forever chemicals are group of man-made hazardous products known as PFAS (polyfluoroalkyl substances) that have spread globally through water courses, oceans, soils and atmosphere. Hence, they can now be found even in rainwater and snow, researchers said.

388.title: High severity threats detected in iOS, iPadOS, ChromeOS, Firefox: CERT-In
388.article_body: Indian Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-In) has found several highly severe vulnerabilities in iOS, iPadOS and macOS, along with Google's ChromeOS and Mozilla's Firefox browser. These vulnerabilities can be used to bypass security restrictions and cause denial-of-service attacks on users, rendering their devices unusable. These vulnerabilities can be fixed by installing software updates.

389.title: Will crack down on Islamic extremism if elected UK PM: Rishi Sunak
389.article_body: UK Prime Ministerial candidate Rishi Sunak on Wednesday said that he will crack down on Islamic extremism if voted to power, adding that he will bring necessary reforms to the country's anti-terror 'Prevent' programme. He also termed Islamic extremism as UK's "most significant terror threat". Sunak needs to win in the Conservative Party members' postal ballot to become the PM.

390.title: China must not help Russia: Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy
390.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Wednesday said China must not support Moscow in the Russia-Ukraine war and at least maintain its neutrality. “As for now, China is balancing and indeed has neutrality and...neutrality is better than China joining Russia,” Zelenskyy said. China has refused to criticise Russia's invasion of Ukraine but condemned US-led sanctions against Moscow.

391.title: Actor Dev Patel breaks up knife fight outside convenience store in Australia
391.article_body: Actor Dev Patel successfully stopped a street fight in Adelaide, Australia. Reports suggest that a man and a woman were having a knife fight outside a convenience store and the man was stabbed in the chest. The actor stepped in and stopped the fight. According to reports, the person stabbed in the chest is expected to survive.

392.title: Which 9 Indian companies feature on 2022 Fortune Global 500 list?
392.article_body: As many as nine Indian companies feature on 2022 Fortune Global 500 list. LIC is ranked 98th, while Reliance Industries is ranked 104th. Other Indian companies on the list are Indian Oil, Oil and Natural Gas, SBI, Bharat Petroleum, Tata Motors, Tata Steel and Rajesh Exports. The list ranks the world's largest corporations by revenue for fiscal 2021.

393.title: Which are the top 10 companies on 2022 Fortune Global 500 list?
393.article_body: Fortune on Wednesday announced the Fortune Global 500 list for 2022, ranking the world's largest corporations by revenue for fiscal 2021. Walmart has claimed the top spot for the ninth consecutive year. The top 10 includes four companies from the US, four from China and one each from Saudi Arabia and Germany.

394.title: MicroStrategy CEO Michael Saylor steps down after firm reports $900 mn in crypto losses
394.article_body: MicroStrategy Co-founder Michael Saylor has stepped down as the CEO of the company after the business-software company reported over $900 million in crypto losses. The company reported a second-quarter loss of around $1 billion. Saylor will move into the role of executive chairman, MicroStrategy said. MicroStrategy's president Phong Le will take on the additional role of CEO effective next week.

395.title: Amount involved in delayed payments to MSMEs doubled in 2 yrs: Govt
395.article_body: The amount involved in pending applications for delayed payment cases by MSMEs in FY22 nearly doubled from the FY20 amount, Union Minister BPS Verma said. Pending delayed payment applications involved ₹5,685 crore in FY22 to be paid by MSME buyers, up 97% from ₹2,887 crore stuck in FY20. The amount has to be paid by government departments, PSUs, etc.

396.title: Terror funding in J&K being done through Bitcoin trade from Pak: SIA
396.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Special Investigative Agency (SIA) on Wednesday carried out series of raids and found that terror financing in union territory is being done via Bitcoin trade, police said. "Details that are being investigated into...include a mastermind in Pakistan...who...has been pumping...money to...agents in J&K," police added. SIA also seized several phones and documents linked to suspects.

397.title: I am the father of expressway toll in India: Gadkari in Parliament
397.article_body: Union Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari on Wednesday told Rajya Sabha members, "Fortunately or unfortunately, I'm the father of this toll because, for the first time in this country, I started the toll system." He said this after MPs expressed concerns over setting up of toll plazas on expressways inside city limits. Gadkari added that the issue will be rectified.

398.title: Mehbooba puts up new Twitter display picture with old J&K flag
398.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti on Wednesday uploaded a fresh display picture on Twitter, showing her late father Mufti Mohammad Sayeed and Prime Minister Narendra Modi with the Indian and old Jammu and Kashmir flags. "You... robbed us of our flag,” Mehbooba wrote. Modi earlier urged citizens to widely share the tricolour on social media ahead of Independence Day.

399.title: UP woman falls into deep gorge in U'khand while taking selfie; dies
399.article_body: A 28-year-old woman from Uttar Pradesh died after falling into a gorge while taking a selfie on the Rishikesh-Badrinath Highway, the State Disaster Response Force said on Wednesday. The deceased was returning from Kedarnath to Rishikesh in a car on Tuesday when she fell into the gorge near the Kaudiyala area, SDRF in-charge (Dhalwala) Kavindra Sajwan said.

400.title: No doubt Irani's family runs bar in Goa, she's a pathological liar: Cong
400.article_body: Congress spokesperson Girish Chodankar on Wednesday said there's no doubt that Union Minister Smriti Irani and her family runs Goa's Silly Souls Cafe and Bar, which allegedly had an illegal bar license. Eightall Food and Beverage, a company belonging to Irani's family, and the bar in question have the same GST number, Chodankar said. "She's a pathological liar," he added.

401.title: Babu Genu Chowk opened for traffic in Pune ahead of Ganesh Chaturthi
401.article_body: Maharashtra Metro Rail Corporation Limited has opened Pune's Babu Genu Chowk for traffic to avoid congestion during Ganesh Chaturthi celebrations. The route was closed due to metro work near Mahatma Phule Mandai. "As various stalls have been put up for the festive season, including Raksha Bandhan...we decided to open the stretch for public," the metro company's PRO Hemant Sonawane said.

402.title: Wealth management platform dezerv. raises $20 mn in Series A round
402.article_body: Wealth management startup, dezerv., has raised $20.7 million in its Series A funding round. The round was led by Accel Partners and saw participation from existing investors such as Elevation Capital, Matrix Partners, Whiteboard Capital, and GTM Ventures. The startup claims to have transacted assets of over ₹600 crore (as of June 2022) on its platform.

403.title: Fintech unicorn Yubi partners with U GRO Capital for MSME co-lending
403.article_body: Debt marketplace Yubi (formerly CredAvenue) has partnered with BSE-listed small business lending platform U GRO Capital. With the partnership, Yubi intends to integrate co-lending platform Yubi Co.Lend and supply chain finance platform Yubi FLow with U GRO's co-lending platform GRO Xstream and supply chain finance platform GRO-Line, respectively. Yubi said it has over 750 lenders on its platform.

404.title: Fintech startup Credit Fair raises $10 mn in seed extension round
404.article_body: Lending fintech startup, Credit Fair, has raised $10 million in debt and equity as part of its seed extension round. The round was led by LC Nueva Investment Partners and saw participation from venture capital fund Capital A and Sattva Family Office, among others. Founded in 2018, Mumbai-based Credit Fair has raised a total of $25 million, to date.
